5/10? Just average. Fun to wear once. Baggy, but thats the style. Size down if you don't embrace that.

links_reviews_title: Decent...a little weird in the crotch area
links_reviews_text: These are decent daytime pants. Loved the high waist but didn't like the weird bagginess around the crotch. Perhaps I should've sized down a bit...
These pants are amazing and so cute! Can style a few different ways and super comfy.

links_reviews_title: Didn't end up wearing out of the house
links_reviews_text: It's the weird middle panel in the waistband. That's what ruins these pants for me. I loved the look online and figured I could outwit the bad reviews if I ordered a smaller size. But. That flat weird middle part just bunches up (even when the size isn't too big) and just looks like a giant belly pooch. It also showed the bottom edge of every shirt I tried to tuck in. Maybe a body suit? I wish the cute pleats just went all the way up. In the end, I sent the pants back without wearing.

links_reviews_title: Wish they weren't dry clean only
links_reviews_text: These pants are super comfortable but they wrinkle easily and they are dry clean only- otherwise I would have kept them longer! If you're in between sizes then I would size down.

These run "slouchy" so there's no need to size up to get the intended fit. I normally wear a 10 but I rented a 12 because that was all that was available. They were really big on me. I probably could've worn an 8 if I wanted them to be more tailored. They worked because you can cinch the belt & they are supposed to look slouchy. Loved! otherwise. I wish I had had more to do in them then run errands. Would've been stylish and totally functional for a fun day in the park or some other sort of outdoor mischief. I could also see them being dressed up for a fancier daytime affair
I wore with a white button down J Crew blouse (tucked in) & the look was adorable. The pants are very comfortable and the exposed buttons are nice touch. Will rent again!
I wish these fit better! The style is so cute, but the waist waist was so large that they kept slipping.

links_reviews_title: Baggy and long--not great for petites
links_reviews_text: The fit on these are baggy and long. I did not wear out. Cute idea but just looked like cheap painters pants.

the color is pretty. the material does have a bit of shine. super lightweight. the buttonfly is gorgeous. but they are so big and unflattering. I love a paperbag style but these should have been cut smaller for a 0.
The print on this skirt was bright and bold. Loved the fit of this skirt. It was high waisted and was a midi length on me. The flouncy edge was cute and moved well when you walked. Love it!
Loved the bottom. Very cute and appropriate for the office. See more looks on my RTR insta highlights @leahgay and feel free to DM me any questions!

links_reviews_title: Very pretty but tailoring wrong for me
links_reviews_text: I love the fabric and pattern, and the whole look. It gaped a bit at the top leaving pouchy open space in an area I'd like to minimize. I'm 5'8 and the length was great for me . Looked good with knee high boots. Would rent again but won't buy it: expensive for something that doesn't fit perfectly.
This for great, was comfortable, and super flattering. Only con was that it wrinkled pretty easily from sitting.
It was a nice quality material with some weight to it; downside: it does wrinkle easily. It had a nice shape and fit to it. I just wish the waist was tighter to have the option to make it sit higher.

The photo looks like this would be a sleek sort of material, sorta dressy but it's cotton and definitely wrinkles when you sit. It was cute enough to wear but nothing I would rent again, plus a bit too long for 5'2".

Fun summer skirt for work! As others noted there is no stretch (other than a little in the waist) so I sized up to a large. I'm typically a medium /8, and I think the large is a little loose in my hips, but it still works. Would probably rent a medium for going out so it was more fitted, but for work this was perfect.
Very cute but a bit tight around the hips while a little large on the waist

links_reviews_title: Rented this for a Mexico vacation and it was perfect. The fit is amazing and it is very flattering!
links_reviews_text: The waist is fitted but with some elastic in the back making it a structured yet flexible outfit. I would rent this ago for another vacation for sure!
Loved this skirt! Super comfy and fit true to size. I'm usually a 4 or 6 depending the brand and the Small was perfect.
Sexy and can be chic with the right tight basic top. Could be worn dressier, but I wore to work.

The skirt had tags, always a plus. I thought it was cute, but ladies it has no stretch whatsoever. If you have a booty or hips size up. It zips up, not elastic. It was a fun skirt, but arrived very wrinkled and wrinkled throughout the day even after ironing, it's made of light cotton. It has a lining so it wasn't see through. I liked it, but I wouldn't rent it again.
Fun and flirty, would rent again

links_reviews_title: Great color and design, but not great for hippy girls
links_reviews_text: This is a great skirt. I love the design and where it lands on my body, but unfortunately, if you have bigger hips, thighs, it's pretty tight.

links_reviews_title: These hips dont lie to the tune of me singing shakira in the bathroom trying this on.
links_reviews_text: Like other reviews say, a little tight in the hips. I just love yellow skirts and a trumpet shape so hand it try but it was a very sad nah. Like was for sure rip that bad boy if I tried. But also feel like the large would be too big in areas besides the hip?? I dunno man, I'm sad about it. It's a pretty nonforgiving cotton which is probs a contributing factor.
Makes the most of your curves, works well if you don't have too many. No stretch, fun to wear with the flouncy bottom.
This skirt was super fun for a night out in Cabo!
Too tight on the booty and no wiggle room

links_reviews_title: This skirt was a beautiful color and such a fun print !
links_reviews_text: Overall the material, the color and print were great ! The skirt was definitely tighter/ more hip hugging than I expected so I didn't end up wearing it . Also It was a good length for petites( not to long)

this size 'large' is probably a large 6/small 8 at best. not a typical large....couldn't even get this skirt past my hips. it's cotton and has no stretch at all. not for good for curvy/hourglass/anyone with anything resembling hips.

links_reviews_title: If you have curves or a booty size up
links_reviews_text: Material was nice and pattern beautiful... but definitely not made for girls with a booty (at least it's not made to fit comfortably- unless you're into feeling like you're in a sausage casing)

links_reviews_title: Don't plan on wearing it closed
links_reviews_text: So, I loved the look of this piece zipped up in the photos- to be clear, you can't really wear it that way. The inner layer that needs to be pulled smooth once you zip it up has nowhere to attach. All of that drapy fabric next to the zipper stays draped down on the inside of the sweater once you zip it, leaving it bulky in the front. It was a bummer, but it was still comfortable and cute. Would still rent again, just with adjusted expectations.

links_reviews_title: Great staple piece for colder temps
links_reviews_text: Love love this sweater! Fabric is smooth and soft and the leather detailing kicks it up a notch. Cute zipped and unzipped, casual with jeans and nicer with slacks. Will rent again!

This light sweater zip up is super comfortable and fits perfectly with the exception of the sleeves. They are just a hair snug so if you have some big guns size up!! The zipper is flattering and the arms have leather that add a bit of class and kicks it up a notch. I do t want to give this one back.
Versatile, chic. Can be dressed up or down. Wore multiple times over a dress and with jeans. Comfortable and warm.

I lived all the details of this sweater, but they didn't work well together. The draping in the front tended to bunch to one side under the zipper when zipped, which made it look frumpy, despite the slim cut.

At first, it had a weird smell to it. I don't know if it was the chemicals from the dry cleaning. But overall, I love the white color and how this sweater is super flattering. I am 38C cup and trying to hide my belly from previous babies. It's perfect for everyday to wear in the office and even just for casual every day. I'm leaving on a trip in a few weeks and it's the perfect layering piece. I wish I could buy one.
This piece is both comfortable and flattering at the same time. It's perfect for casual leisure wear or for wearing to work!
Love the look, feel and fit. Would buy this!!

links_reviews_title: I wore this so many time, but forgot to take a photo!
links_reviews_text: This swing jacket is wonderful! I wore it four times for the comfort and cool vibe. It dresses up, but feels cozy. The cream color is gorgeous and looks great with skinny black pants and ankle boots. I could have kept this and worn forever.
Not great for bigger arms tight but it was pretty if it fit!

links_reviews_title: Perfect for a versatile light weight jacket.
links_reviews_text: I previously rented this and loved it so much that I rented it again for vacation in San Diego this December. Love the style and weight of it but unfortunately this one was a lot more worn looking than the one previously rented.
Slightly long for 5'2", so I had to turn under the hem by one cuff length. However they did stay tucked up on their own all day. Paired with the Victoria Beckham Red Ruffle Turtleneck.
These are your reliable, tried and true navy pants. They're flattering, they fit, great length and they hold that way all day. Pair with a blouse and you're set.

Their pants fit me perfectly! Though I will admit I must go up a size from other brands. These pants feel great and fit great. Hard to tell whether they are navy or black but I think think navy. Highly recommend if you don't know Club Monaco, get to know them
The fit was flattering. The fabric was nice. It stretched over the course of a day and was a little baggy by the end of the day- but still looked good.
I felt great in these pants. Very slimming.

links_reviews_title: They were cute but didn't fit well

links_reviews_text: These felt and fit great! Only downfall is the fabric stretched with the day. And by the end of the day they were quite loose. Though overall I loved them.
Love these. Definitely a wardrobe staple.

links_reviews_title: Cute pants - just wished I realized they were navy?!
links_reviews_text: The pants were great - fit was perfect - however, I thought they were black when I rented them. I should have paid more attention.
These pants are amazing! The fit was great and they are so comfortable. Highly recommend.
Great trousers, lovely material, great fit but too tight for me.

links_reviews_title: High quality, superb fit. A staple item for any wardrobe.
links_reviews_text: This were so comfortable, a little sad I sent them back after one wear.

links_reviews_title: Good fit, mid-waist, does not cut into the belly.
links_reviews_text: Fits well but the material is very poor. It collects lint and gets light spots all over. Very difficult to clean and keep it look sharp. But the fit and shape are great.
Fit fine around the thighs but a bit loose around the waist. These are navy blue but almost look black. I just don't think the pant is particularly special. They were fine for a plain navy work pant.
Very comfortable pants. Super dark blue. Oils be mistaken for black. Pocket zippers are a nice design element. However the pockets are not really useful because of them.
These are really great pants.
These were a little tight when I put them on but they stretched just enough to become comfortable without any sag. Hit at the ankle for me.

So I originally LOVED these pants. They fit great when I first tried them on. However, after wearing them at work for a couple hours they stretched out so much. By the end of the day I kept having to pull them up. Size down.

Pants started a bit on the tighter side but stretched quite a bit throughout the day. Comfortable and versatile. I should have read the description details a bit more - I thought the picture looked like these were black pants, but they look more like a dark navy in person.

links_reviews_title: They looked loose. Just not my style i love the Navy blue color.
links_reviews_text: They looked loose. Just not my style i love the Navy blue color.
pants were tight
Fit very nicely. Very professional.
Fit perfect, tons of compliments!

links_reviews_title: I'm typically a size 4. These pants were too big - didn't even consider wearing.
links_reviews_text: Runs large
spice up your work wear with this leopard pencil skirt. super high waist pairs perfectly with cropped sweaters. structured but thin material wears well.

links_reviews_title: Runs small, thin material, very cute!
links_reviews_text: Material is very thin, but not see through, just papery. Wrinkled easily throughout the day. Sizing is quite small, I'm a true size 6 at 5'9" 145 lbs, but I comfortably wore the size 8. I paired it with a black body suit and really liked the look. I would wear again. The length was perfect for my height. I love midi skirts and this one was no different. Glad I read in the reviews to size up!

Fabric was stiff and thick (like paper), not what I expected. Was also very long, went slightly above my ankles and I'm 5'7". I'm also between a 4 and a 6 and wore a 4 and it was pretty tight. Would not recommend for anyone shorter than 5'8!

links_reviews_title: I did not get to wear it.
links_reviews_text: Very thin paper like fabric. No give or stretch. Not meant for curves. 2 sizes to small.
I was reallllly disappointed in the quality of the skirt. I could have made this with a simple cheap piece of fabric. I would not recommend this skirt
...But then it probably still won't fit. I ordered one size up and it was too tight in the hips but too big in the waist and awkwardly long. Not meant for curves.
I love the colors, but the skirt was a bit tight and rigid- not much give to walk because the material wasn't at all stretchy. Didn't end up wearing sadly.

links_reviews_title: Cute and comfortable. Runs long, so better for a tall girl
links_reviews_text: Wore this for a Christmas brunch. Comfy fabric, and first true to size. Just runs a little long in my opinion
Great cut, great material, not too heavy for summer wear.

links_reviews_title: Attractive pattern and fit, a bit long
links_reviews_text: This fit a bit long on me but was a nice professional but punchy pattern and great fit.
Got so many complements on this!! Will likely rent again

links_reviews_title: Really cute but probably best for someone tall
links_reviews_text: At 5'4" it fit me really high on the rib cage but still came down past mid-calf. Loved the pattern and still looked stylish and modern.
Would have been great in petite
I am squarely a size 6, and I couldn't zip this extremely tight pencil skirt. Cool print, but extremely small. I wouldn't recommend.
Great for work. Light fabric for hot summer days.

This skirt is long, but at 6' tall it was a great length for me. It was also a tight/stretchy fit with a high waist. I paired with a fitted white button down blouse (tucked in) & received tons of compliments. The print is awesome.
The skirt came down to my ankles. Would've loved to see this in a petite.

I rented this to wear to an 80s birthday party. It definitely fit the bill. One thing to note, it is definitely a unisex fit, so if I were wearing this for every day and not for a specific 80s look, I would have ordered a small. It is definitely a fun, vibrant twist on the traditional Adidas tracksuit.
Definitely have to tie it tight to keep it up. Comfortable to walk and lounge in. Very good quality of course.
I'm 5'4 and these were way too long. They were also pretty thick, so prepare for warmth.

links_reviews_title: My son said I looked like Vector
links_reviews_text: You know the movie Despicable Me? This orange pantsuit looks made me look like Vector . I had to send it back

I love an adidas track suit- reminds me of my college days when I would break dance at Friday night sigma nu parties and do dance battles with my crew on the weekends. Now I wear track suits to feel nostalgic while I shelter in place. I also threw on the pants during a zoom dance class for a Justin Timberlake homage. Whole suit was cute and comfortable. Style with shell toes and gold chain for the full effect.
I put runs small because I am a true large and ordered a Medium. This dress was alright, I got complaints, but it's not truly my style. It was super comfy for work though!

Fit is a little loose from body but in a flattering way so I can see this working on a lot of different body types. I wore this all through the fall with flats and boots and tights and blazers and sweaters depending on the weather. It is super versatile. I am even getting use out of it in the winter with a black turtleneck bodysuit underneath. I loved it so much I had to keep it. It also gives me really 90's vibes that I love.

links_reviews_title: Easy for a third trimester bump
links_reviews_text: Would probably wear a size small but at 32-33 weeks pregnant I went with a medium and fit great. Easy for work - would rent again!
Really cute patterned dress. The sleeves had little puffed shoulders which was a nice touch too. Nice quality, my only issue was that it was a little long (but I'm 5'3" so I'm used to that).
This dress fits large on the bottom. Perfect for a comfy outfit at the office on a Friday.
I'm 5'1" and this dress fit well - the sleeves came just to my wrists. Not sure how it'd fit the taller girls, but I would've bought it if the discount was better. Cute print
This was the perfect dress for the office or brunch

links_reviews_title: Comfy, cute, and easy to play with
links_reviews_text: I wore this with wool tights and my slightly-polished combat boots, and I loved the 90s realness! Buttoning the neck all the way up is the way to go. (Also, pockets!)
Simple dress that transitions from work to night -- good with leggings or tights.
Great dress for every day. Not body hugging or the most high fashion but still looks very nice while being super comfortable.
Love this dress. Can't wait to wear it again.

The size L was not available when I rented so I got the XL. Big mistake. I think because the dress is already made a bit loose I was drowning in the XL. The high neckline also didn't look that great on me. Don't size up in this.
Live this dress!! It is very comfortable, a great length and looked great with multiple shoe styles. I am debating on keeping this one. Rent it, you won't be sorry.
This light weight dress was great for my recent trip. It's comfortable, the print is cute and classic, and it was easy to steam out the travel wrinkles.
Wasn't able to wear this dress. Fit ok throughout the body of the dress but the length and sleeves were too short.

I rented this for work. I paired it with leggings and booties. It is a perfect weight for fall. It was easy to wear (after I put pins in the spaces between the buttons because boobs) and I liked it a lot.

Super cute, very comfy. Totally work appropriate but once I threw on a leather jacket, ankle boots, and better earrings was set to go out for drinks with girlfriends. The pockets make this a slam dunk. Will be renting again...might need to buy it!

Loved this jacket! It was breathable, something I was concerned about with a larger bust. It also tightens at the bottom to show off my waist, which I loved. The only bummer is that it squeaked sometimes
Tons of compliments. It fit as described

links_reviews_title: Love the look but a bit noisy
links_reviews_text: The contrast black and white is super cute. The only issue is the material is super loud and sticks to itself. Although a bit noisy like an old school rain coat it was actually really comfortable. The belt was super cute as well. Great for the rain!

links_reviews_title: Statement piece - great alternative to the black leather jacket
links_reviews_text: Rented for a concert, wore closed and then open- both looked great! Stand-out jacket in a sea of black leather jackets
Never even wore this because ever inch I moved the jacket would make the loudest noises. Insane.

links_reviews_title: It's pretty comfy and it looks great!
links_reviews_text: However....it is very hot and squeaky. It feels like you're wearing an Ikea bag since it's made out of glossy PVC. Wore it for an hour then took it off and immediately returned. Very pretty and nice fit though.
OMG- could not wear it. I felt like I was wrapped in Saran wrap- every movement squeeked and drove me nuts! The fit was fine- spot on. Returned without wearing.

links_reviews_title: So many compliments on this item I wore it to work multiple days in the week!
links_reviews_text: Absolutely amazing, stylish, edgy– I love everything about this jacket and may end up buying it. The jacket is very warm (made entirely out of Faux leather). The one downside is the buckle - so loud walking around the office! I felt like I was walking a dog with a noisy collar because it jangled everywhere I went. And you can't take the buckle off since it's sewn into the jacket and not removable. I've never received more compliments on an item of clothing at work - just flashy, trendy fun!
I thought i could make that work, but it was to bold statement for me, fabric is stiff & crunchy & it was tight in sleeves, but i am sure will make lovely photos
This jacket is comfortable and sooo what's the word? Perfect for everyday and my southern weather.
This jacket is everything. It's a statement piece that fits well and just really makes you feel awesome. Loved!
Top fits true to size and is a great pop of color! Sad to send it back

links_reviews_title: Cute printed top. Not a button front.
links_reviews_text: Cute top. Great sleeves. Not too low cut in the front. It looks like a button placard but it's not. Really easy and light fabric. Recommend for casual everyday wear.
Nice color and fit. V neck not too low
Lovely fabric and easy to wear. Not sure how flattering it is as it's baggy, not fitted, but I liked it
Loved this top. Simple yet great quality and a fun color/ print for summer. Fit TTS.
Such a cute top, wish the 12 was available to rent. If you are bustier, size up. Hopefully I can rent it again in the right size.
Lovely color, beautiful light fabric. A great blouse !
Loved the fit on this blouse. Perfect for day to night. Definitely bright so will hold off on wearing in nyc until spring
Great color, cute cut!

links_reviews_title: super comfortable and classy for work
links_reviews_text: I usually wear a smaller size (6) but they didn't have it at the store and the 8 worked just fine. It's intentionally flowy, so you can get away with sizing up or down if your regular size isn't in stock. I really like the flower/star pattern, and got several compliments.
fits true to size. was a fun pretty top. i liked it. nothing crazy going on here but a pretty top.
Pros: Beautiful and vibrant color; comfortable fabric; flattering fit Cons: Wrinkles very easily (I wore it out to dinner, and by the time I got up from my seat it did not look polished)
Easy every day shirt. Can be tuckedd in for a different look.
It was just sort of extra boxy bc it had a short torso, so stuck out more. If it had been longer it would've been more flattering and not make me look like I'm hiding a belly

links_reviews_title: I did not where it. Loved the color and the sleeves. It was so cute but WAY to small in the chest!
links_reviews_text: I did not where it. Loved the color, pattern, weight and the sleeves. It was so cute but WAY to small in the chest! I where 38D and the 12 was too little.
I'm 5'3, 130 lbs with a large chest and the size 4 fit perfectly and the neckline wasn't too low to wear to work. The bright color is really soft and the fabric is silky and feels great.
I loved the cut of the shirt, especially neckline. It was perfect for every day and I had a hard time sending it back.
Flowy, but still flattering. Very airy feel and unrestrictive sleeves.

links_reviews_title: Soft and comfy. Red is beautiful.
links_reviews_text: This is a nice top. The red is beautiful. Nice for work day. Nothing overly unique. But the material is so nice!
Just a really nice, well-made, feminine top. I dressed down with some jeans. Would buy if it weren't still a million dollars.

Great top! Sleeves give it a little something special. Wore this top partially tucked into high waisted jeans. Perfect casual, but office appropriate look. Material is light and flowy. Would consider purchasing if it wasn't so expensive!! Will definitely hold for a few weeks before returning and will most likely rent again.

links_reviews_title: Very flattering top! Great for work and weekend.
links_reviews_text: Very flattering top. Perfect to translation from day to night. #daytonight #workwear
This top is simple and unassuming, good for everyday summer wear.

links_reviews_title: Good to pair with denim and sandals!
links_reviews_text: A little bulky in the shoulders but great for if you like that kind of look :)

This blouse is conservative but fun at the same time. The delicate little flowers and flutter sleeves add a great touch. It is a little formal to throw on with jeans, but overall versatile. Recommend as a pretty, easy to throw on blouse.
The color and shape of this top is beautiful. Perfect for summer
Loved this top. It's so light and airy, perfect for Texas summers. It was to easy to go from the office to out for drinks with this fun top. Tons of compliments, absolutely recommend.
Loved this top. Really easy and effortless to wear, great fit (especially on sleeves) and true to size. Looks great with white or denim jeans. Perfect for summer.
The fit was perfect. The folded detail down the center detracts from my gut. The color just didn't work on me. It's a very bright, almost orange, red.

Loved this shirt. It was light and flowy, comfortable, and nicely detailed! I would suggest if you're between sizes to go for the smaller size - I'm usually a 4 or 6 and rented the 6. It worked, but would have been a bit more flattering if it was slightly more fitted.

links_reviews_title: Great dress, didn't get to wear it though :(
links_reviews_text: It's a beautiful dress and a great fit! I unfortunately didn't get to wear it due to the event being canceled because of covid-19. :(

links_reviews_title: Great Neckline, Very Flattering, Wear Spanx!
links_reviews_text: Neckline and sleeves are unique and flattering. Color is great. The body of this dress is fitted, but fabric is thick enough to not feel "clubby" and the skirt wide enough to not feel corporate (pencil skirt). Lots of compliments, would fit great on someone with a smaller bust, but thats reformation for ya.

Loved this dress and got a lot of compliments. I would rent it again- very flattering but revealing in the chest area so I kept self consciously pulling at the front. Overall it felt and looked great and it could be worn in any season.

Rented this for an awards dinner and couldn't tell you how many compliments I got. I'm familiar with Reformation so I went a size up and got a 6. Upon first try on it felt snug but Ref dresses do have some give and stretch as you wear them, so don't worry! I'm 5'9 and about 140 athletic so I wore this without shapewear and no bra. Enough support up top but I definitely got a little concerned as the dress stretched out a bit.

I rented this dress for my best friend's rehearsal dinner. I ended up loving the unique color and the flattering fit, but this dress is definitely VERY busty. I'm a 34DD and I felt a little uncomfortable showing so much cleavage. But the fit of the dress is very flattering! The size 2 fit me better in the waist, but was too tight in the bust, so I ended up wearing the size 4.

links_reviews_title: Pretty and amazing neckline, but tight
links_reviews_text: I'm a true 6 and this ran small on me. It realllly squeezed my chest and I'm not super busty, although it made me look that way

links_reviews_title: Great for girls with curves hips!
links_reviews_text: I recommend wearing spanks. Dress is tight fitting but comfortable. Love the neckline, great for small breasted women. Best part are the puffed sleeves.

links_reviews_title: I felt beautiful in this dress (rare) and got tons of compliments.
links_reviews_text: Very fitted in the bust, but I’ve never worn a dress that better accentuated my breasts. I’m a 36A and it would have smooshed by boobs if they were any bigger (tiny titty committee girls rejoice). Also pleasantly fitted in the waist and hips, thighs are pretty free. The bias cut of the viscose hangs well and smooths over imperfections, spanx help though. Photos show me wearing it off the shoulder but I put them up as intended. I normally fall between 6-8/S-M and wore the 8 so I could eat without breaking the dress.

Loved the color and neckline of this dress. I got the size 2 and 4 - both fit well but the 4 was a little big in the waist for me so I wore the 2. Its fitted and a little small in the cups - so not completely ideal if you are busty. I went no-bra and it worked out great. Received tons of compliments and would definitely rent again!

Loved this dress. Fit like a glove everywhere but the bust where it was too small. I managed, but would probably look for a different undergarment if I were to rent again - the top of my strapless bra kept peaking out since it was so low/tight.

links_reviews_title: I would never hesitate to Rent the Runway!
links_reviews_text: Great Dress for a wedding guest!
Very pretty dress but it does run small. There wasn't a lot of give, so sadly I wasn't able to wear it.

The upper part of the dress was “ok”, but the rest wasn’t even lined. And both sizes were skin tight - it showed EV ER Y THING. I wanted it to work so badly but I was just so disappointed the quality and the fit!!

Loved this raspberry dress for a fall wedding I attended. I felt very pretty, but women with bigger chests, beware! I am around a 34 DD and felt the need to pull up very often. It does wrinkle quite easily, so if that bothers you, I'd opt for something different. Otherwise, great classic silhouette with fun sleeves.
Shows chest without showing too much. Tighter on the mid section.
This dress runs small and has a tendency to wrinkle when you sit. I was able to manipulate a bit when I was sitting to keep it relatively smooth. The dress is gorgeous though - I would recommend.
Great for work travel. Cute neckline

This was a great dress for work. It was comfortable and easy. It was a little large in the chest area even though I am a 32D and wore an extra small it slipped down over the edge of my bra cup a few times.

links_reviews_title: I was planning to wear it for work. My husband said it was more appropriate for a special event.
links_reviews_text: Really love the fit. Hides the love handles and belly
True to size
Pretty standard work dress... Nothing too exciting or special but nice fit and flattering neckline. Good length for work (I'm 5'11").
Very versatile dress loved the cut line. Perfect for all body shapes and sizes especially curvy girls. Definitely recommend.
The fit is fun and flattering. I use a cami under it rather than fight the low V neckline and I love the 3/4 sleeves.

I liked this simple and great work dress! The sweetheart neckline might need to be taped down for bustier ladies, but it worked with my C-cups. Nice dress for fall/between seasons. Includes a faux wrap tie on the left hip.
This is a classic. However, too revealing in the chest area. Had to wear with high neck lace bralette to add some coverage. Added red flats for a pop of color.
I love everything about this dress. It looks elegant, it is comfy to wear and it's very flattering. I'll definitely rent it again!

links_reviews_title: Great dress, might need a camisole
links_reviews_text: This dress is so beautiful and drapes nicely. I am very small chested and had to wear a camisole as the gathered top was too large and kind of fell open. Big fan of the houndstooth print!
This has been my favorite. The fabric is very comfortable and the fit is flattering. I will be renting this one again!
Pretty shape to this, it fit well but the neckline was lower than I'd like for work. It's also unlined, which surprised me. Nice silhouette, just not work appropriate!

I wore this dress for work- I'm smaller chested than most women who are a size 10. I could get away with it but the dress was a little loose on top so had to make sure I was checking in over the course of the day to make sure I wasn't revealing too much. Extremely comfortable, easy to wear, figure flattering cut, I'm not sure how flattering the print was all over. I wouldn't buy but I would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Weird unflattering neckline - not for high waisted women
links_reviews_text: Was so looking forward to this dress, but like all this line the waist is cut quite low and on me it was not flattering. Great dress for long waisted girls- comfy and lots of stretch
Very cute cut. Very flattering. The print is a little boring, and it's a little long for petite gals.

links_reviews_title: A little cleavage but great dress
links_reviews_text: True to size, would travel like a dream. Great classic pattern and style. Got a ton of compliments. Not exactly a power dress for work but fun and feminine.

links_reviews_title: I wore this dress for the first day of an education conference I hosted. It was perfect.
links_reviews_text: The fit was true to size, the material is lightweight, and the overall look was very polished.
Cute but nothing exceptionally special. Didn't feel super high quality. Nice shape to the neckline.

links_reviews_title: Wore this to work and loved it!
links_reviews_text: It was light weight and breathable. I would rent again.
Super comfortable work wrap dress but runs a bit big and looks somewhat frumpy on due to the length on me.
Nice way to wear the trend with out committing too much to it. The fit was small, I sized up and it was still tight in the shoulders and pulling around my bust.
this silk shirt gets everything right: print, colors, fit and shape. the fabric is soft and luxurious. never wanted to send it home!
Loved it. Got compliments wherever I went. Would have kept but needed a cleaning. Will def rent again.

This shirt is surprisingly sexy! It has the perfect amount of cleavage (although I did use a clothespin) and looks great casually tucked into shorts or skinny jeans. This is the perfect shirt for an outdoor festival! Very colorful and even my husband loved this one! It is a bit on the snug side, so be sure to size up. This is also bc it's real silk and does not have any give whatsoever. It is also a little bit too short, so it's not real flattering if you leave it untucked. I would rent again!
Wore this to a western-themed work event, and it was perfect for the party. The silk fabric makes you feel like you're wearing pajamas and the detailing elevates it from being too kitschy.
Wore this shirt on a literal cattle drive on a dude ranch vacation. Super lightweight and comfortable and fits true to size. Highly recommended for all of your western needs.

Amazing top - overall the fit was true to size but the sleeves were tight. I recommend sizing up if you'd like more comfort here. I unbuttoned the sleeve and felt a lot more comfortable. Such an easy way to try the western trend without going too literal. Also, the mixed print is heaven.
I wore this to the Rodeo and got tons and tons of compliments from both men and women! Wish I would have sized up so it would stay tucked in.

I'm a bit on the petite size and I found the small narrow through the shoulders and the sleeves just fit. It's a nicely made shirt and super cute for work with a pair of dress pants. I recommend it but consider sizing up unless you have narrow shoulders.
I loved this top! Wore on a chill sushi and concert date. The material is wonderful!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful print and cut - just fits small
links_reviews_text: Really fun top, just need to size up. Felt arms and chest area were cut small
Didn't know if I'd like it, but the cut and material (satin) helped immensely in making this a softer, more stylish piece! I had a ton of compliments on it as well. Would definitely rent again.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful shirt, but did not fit.
links_reviews_text: Runs small because of the silk. Definitely size up.
Big fan of this blouse - fun and different. I wore it untucked with dark jeans. Not overly Western - just the right amount. Fits true to size. Wasn't wrinkled which is a nice surprise :)
This was a NWT beautiful silk shirt I wore a few times with faded skinny jeans. The fabric and print are fun, the fit was so-so for me. A bit conventional for my taste.
Runs large Maybe not meant for Petites Made it work and was comfy and light weight for Summer Day
Was just too big.

links_reviews_title: 55% linen, light weight, well constructed, wear once due to wrinkles
links_reviews_text: Light weight blazer perfect for warm weather. Lining is constructed to keep you cool. But with 55% linen expect wrinkles. Dark blue (navy) thread that works well with black.

Light material with a nice textured pattern, I really liked this blazer with jeans and heels. I would note that it's a bit oversized in the torso. I thought it was a cute look, but it's definitely not your classic tailored blazer.

links_reviews_title: Cute blazer but not for everyone
links_reviews_text: The shoulder pads in this blazer just weren't for me. It's super cute though, and it would go with lots of different outfits.
After I reviewed the reviews on this, I knew that I need to take smaller size. It looked great on me.
This jacket was too boxy and not flattering. Size down, maybe? Or skip. The fabric was nice and felt high-end.

links_reviews_title: Great blazer to wear with pencil pants
links_reviews_text: At first I wasn't sure about this blazer. It has a bit of an 80s vibe, with (light) shoulder pads and a boxy body. I couldn't figure out how to wear it to work over a dress but finally figured it out today when I looked back at the model picture. I put it over navy pencil pants with a silk tank and grey pearls and it was great! I knew I had it right when one of the salespeople at Stuart Weitzman complimented me. It's fitted in the shoulder area, so not workable to size down. The longer fit works best if you're taller - I'm 5'7" and liked that I had coverage in the back for tighter pencil pants.

I wore this to work with simple black pants and a white t-shirt. The fabric was light and breathable, perfect for warmer summer/fall days. I’m normally a 6 but ordered an 8 to get to oversize look, but it would’ve been just fine if I ordered my normal size.
I loved this comfy and light (but structured) blazer for work and then again with white jeans. The back wrinkled after I drove around, but it wasn't terrible.
You can dress this blazer up or down. Nice fabric and lightweight.
Nice light blazer for work. Other reviews are spot on regarding the size. I normally wear a 2 in blazers but ordered a 0. It fit fairly well but was still a tad large.

There is no lining or structure to this jacket. It runs large. I downsized from my usual 12 to a 10 and it was still big. I liked the feel and lightness of the material but it wrinkles easily. I only wore this one time. Would not rent again.

I really loved this blazer, but I needed the size down (not available through RTR). That being said, the length was exactly what I was looking for and the fabric is a beautiful blue without looking like denim. It was too big in the shoulders, sleeve length was a touch too long, and the body was healthy.
I have a long torso and this was perfect for me! I have narrower shoulders so sized down. I wish I owned this blazer, was great with a dress for work but also would be great with jeans.
This was perfect for work, I wore it a bunch. Could have gone smaller but the 6 gave me like a "boyfriend" sized look, which is kind of that of the blazer. Will order again

I normally wear a size 10 in Rag and Bone, this was a size 6 and fit perfectly. Would have loved to keep it for the summer and potentially buy it but I didn't think the deal was good enough for a used piece of clothing. Great jacket though.
Looked great with jeans for work and after.

links_reviews_title: I wore it with the matching skirt. I should have worn a smaller size
links_reviews_text: Great workwear
Large / oversized

links_reviews_title: Fab Spring Linen Blazer (with hint of 80s vibe)
links_reviews_text: Fit: Slightly oversized, more of a boxy blazer Pros: High quality linen fabric in a refreshing blue. Buttons are black so works well with black shift dress or black slacks. Cons: It's linen so it gets wrinkled, nothing a good steamer can't fix but something to consider if you're ordering this for a business trip
Con: Wrinkles easily, unlined.
Great with black jeans and a white top. Polished enough for business casual but still relaxed because of the longer cut. More of a box fit.
Oversized blazer look - love the material. Great for work - Spring/Summer

links_reviews_title: The color and feel of the fabric are beautiful.
links_reviews_text: Slightly large but worked when I wore a tight t-shirt underneath.
Loved the material but I didn't realize the blazer is a long cut. So it hit me mid thigh. Didn't end up wearing

links_reviews_title: High waisted and went up 1 size, loved it!
links_reviews_text: Love these, I went up one size. Would love to see these in dark wash
These jeans fit me well and were nice to wear all day. When I said they're a little long' to my boyfriend he said 'that's because you aren't wearing the right boots' :-)

links_reviews_title: I LOVE this dress so much I bought it
links_reviews_text: Perfect fit. A little short. But super cute. I got a zillion compliments.
Perfect dress for work, great fit and I received so many compliments!

links_reviews_title: Very chic and comfortable. Perfect for a spring or fall daytime
links_reviews_text: Love love this dress. Made me feel so confident. The material is very rich and does not crumple at all. I wore it for brunch with my friends and it suited a nice classy place too. You can alternatively even wear it at work and not feel out of place.

I rented this dress for a work party. The style is fantastic. I am usually a size 4 US. The UK size 3 was a little loose on me, but worked with the belt to cinch in the waist. Would definitely rent again!

Wore this dress for a long day of work meetings and got loads of compliments the entire day. Very flattering dress for hourglass figure. Love the pockets. Medium weight fabric was comfortable for June but would be warm enough for fall/winter with tights. Dress was perfect length that hit just above the knee on my short legs but might be a too bit short for work if you're taller.

links_reviews_title: Loved and lots of compliments! Only weird thing is it's very small in the wrists...
links_reviews_text: Loved this for work, ran a little large (US 8 and got the 4), but the sleeves were awkwardly tight and it restricted arm movement a bit. Not a deal breaker by any means but keep in mind if you don't have tiny wrists lol
Gorgeous dress! Great for a work setting, with fun details such as the floral embroidery and sleeve shape. Belt flap was too long so I had to awkwardly tuck it. But overall great!

If I could give this dress a 10 out of five stars I would. It is True to size and adorable. I rented it to wear to a business women's conference. Almost every person I passed commented on my dress. I felt great and even considered buying it. This is a fave. Will rent again!

links_reviews_title: Even better in person, has pockets!
links_reviews_text: I've had my eye on this dress for a while so I was really excited to see it available before an important work meeting. When it arrived, I was so pleased, the detail is even more gorgeous in person. It also has pockets!!! I would definitely recommend this, I feel extra confident and like I'm emitting boss babe vibes in it!
Structured dress. I lift. The zipper was unforgiving. I wore it and it was beautiful and it has pockets!! Love a dress with pockets. But if you lift or have a large chest, size up!!

links_reviews_title: Super flattering, love the floral pattern
links_reviews_text: This was a great dress for a wedding. I'm almost 5'8 and I'd say anyone taller than me would probably have a hard time with the length -- sleeves also felt almost too short. Loved the belt and the floral pattern. :) Lots of compliments!

links_reviews_title: A wow dress with a perfect fit
links_reviews_text: The material is comfortable, style was flattering and gave me a great silhouette. The flower pattern was a great touch to make it more than just a little black dress.
Nice thick fabric, great fit, beautiful design. Fit true to size.

This dress is so beautiful. The embroidery is so lux looking. The waist is the tightest bit with little stretch so fit to that part. Sleeves are long enough but the wrist holes are also small. I didn't want to send it back!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress, great for a formal event
links_reviews_text: This dress fit really well, as someone who is a 0 but with normal lady curves this dress is still a good and appropriate length. The belt was a little long but I got creative with the way I tied it. The sleeves were a little tight but nothing awful. I would rent this again if I needed to.

If I could give this dress more than 5 stars, I would. I have never gotten so many complements in my life. I even got complements when i wore it to a memorial service. Fit is both flattering and comfortable. Stitching detail is stunning. And POCKETS. The only minor drawback is what to do with the floppy belt end. I just tucked it under. Easy peasy.
This is my favorite dress so far! High quality and very flattering. I received tons of compliments.

Loved this dress so much! It was comfortable and the belt (which is rolled up in a pocket of the shipping bag) makes it so flattering and fits every body. I'd be willing to buy this one. (I usually wear a size 6 and the 3 was perfection.)

I really liked this dress when I put it on. It fit perfectly. The two problems were 1. no one could put this dress on alone. Not only did my husband have to zip the back but my son had to button the cuffs. 2. I have thin wrists yet the cuffs were snug. As soon as they moved up even a little bit, they caused red marks on my arms. I wouldn't rent this again.
I received numerous compliments! This is a conservative sexy dress. The embroidery is lovey as well as the fabric and details! I wore it with the Tory Burch red shoulder bag. Love it!!
I took the advice of others and went down a size and it fit perfectly. Very dark navy, reads black. Cute, kind of basic. Thicker fabric so doesn't wrinkle.
This dress is stunning! It looks expensive, fits beautifully and is very classy. I got tons of compliments and would love to own this.

links_reviews_title: Great dress. Loved the color! Fit very well! Super Comfy too!
links_reviews_text: Everything was perfect. Loved the color! Fit great!

links_reviews_title: So cute! Perfect for casual Friday at work
links_reviews_text: Loved this dress. I'm usually a 2 or a 4 and opted for the 2 and it fit perfectly. Clothing is usually tight in the chest and arm for me but this was a perfect fit! Note: the belt comes in a speedster bag!

This dress is beautiful!!! The embroidery is gorgeous and the fabric is thick and very "high-end" - I got this to wear to work but since it was so short (hit right on my upper thigh) I decided to wear tights with it. I originally thought this was a black dress and under certain lightning it does look black but when you go outside in the sun its a very dark navy blue. This dress does run very small and there is absolutely no give to it whatsoever! So my recommendation would be to size up! The only con is that the cuffs are very tight and limit mobility of the arms because the sleeves aren't full length (despite what the picture shows on the model) they kind of hit a weird spot on the arm - other than that I loved this dress! And it has pockets which is also a plus :-)
Fabric is beautiful, fit is amazing, colors crisp!

links_reviews_title: Wanted to love it, but it was just OK
links_reviews_text: It was a bit shorter than expected, it was ok to wear with thick tights at work but it would've been too short without them (I'm only 5'4), wore size 0). That said, the fabric, style and embroidery were wonderful! Just wanted it was 1" longer ....
great fabric well done Ted Baker! i would love to own this one!
Love this dress! It is stunning! This was my backup dress and I wore it to brunch the next day. It was a tad tight in the waist, but I have a wide waist.
This dress is super cute and really flattering. I received so many compliments on it!
US size 6 usually works. Wore the UK 3. Perfect fit, so flattering and long sleeves were great for fall. Received lots of compliments!

I usually wear an 8 but got both the 8 and 10 (3 and 4) and ended up wearing the 4; it is a little tight for bustier ladies which is why I had to size up. It was the perfect length for a work event, but I'm short. It hit just above the knee. It's a beautiful dress and I got a lot of compliments. Best suited for cooler climes or indoor a/c.
Beautiful dress
Lots of compliment and suited for any occasion
Fits perfectly and super flattering

Cute enough dress. It just didn't seem typical Ted. The fold in the front of the dress didn't really know what was going on. I couldn't make it look normal. I think that had something to do with the way it was dry cleaned. In the picture it appears that there is a belt & there are even loops on the dress for a belt but there wasn't a belt. I would not have rented this dress knowing what I do now.
Fits true to size. It is NAVY not black which is hard to tell in the pictures.
True to size, with a perfect cinching belt. The detail work really pops on the navy background

This dress looks great and fits really well. Super classy. My big gripe is that mine was missing the belt! So I had to wear it without and you can see the little thread belt loops. Bummer that I had to wait so long for this to finally become available then when I got it, it was not complete.
Love the embroidery
A real head turner! Got so many compliments and it looked right at home in Miami but stood out at the same time.
Fun dress! Fit true to size, but with an oversized look. I usually size up with Tome but this one was normal. It was see through so I wore a slip. It wasn't that hard to tie in my opinion!

links_reviews_title: Cute but took some time to figure out
links_reviews_text: This dress is sheer so I ended up wearing it with another slip dress underneath. After trying to tie it in front (like the other pictures) I preferred how it looked when I tied it in back.

Fit was a bit big. I probably could of gone a size down for the top part of dress. It's a bit strange to tie but it's very chic and you can dress down. I wore once with sandals and another time with blue blazer and loafers for work. Tons of compliments.

links_reviews_title: Tons of compliments. Wore it to work, and to meetings and felt polished, trendy and approachable.
very chic and fun; tying was stressful tho
links_reviews_text: great fabric, shape, and color. tying was difficult; esp if you are pear or hourglass shaped. but once i stopped stressing about the tie and went for it, it was fine.
Took this on my last trip to Madrid! Did not disappoint ! Yes, the knot is confusing but it's worth it . Just make it work then rock it ! Fabric is ahmazing!
Wanted to love it with the tie dye and color combo and shirtdress but the tie at the waist was a little odd and sleeves were too long/wide

As others have been saying...this garment is a time commitment! Took me a nice long while to figure out how to tie this piece and not create a huge stomach bulge. However, it was a lovely piece and very nice material. It is a bit heavier than anticipated, wouldn't recommend wearing during a heat wave (as I did).

This dress has a lovely silky fabric. I absolutely love the sarong dress styling, however it was quite difficult to figure out how the wear it. The fabric is lightweight and perfect for summer. Just give yourself ample time to adjust the sarong wraps in a manner that creates a smooth line. Still not certain I got it exactly right but love the dress anyway.

Fit: in one word, confusing. I'm normally an 8, but this 6 was available sooner, so i gave it a shot. There's two 'flaps' that hang from the sides that you need to tie in front of you. There's a horizontal seam in the front and back that don't line, and makes it hard to figure out how high up to tie it. The bottom is a bit snug (but i got a size smaller than normal), but the top was SO incredibly baggy. I guessed it would be a looser fitting top, but i felt like i was drowning. I didn't end up wearing it Pros: Great color, soft breathable fabric, in new condition, good length Cons: Fabric is somewhat see-through, the size of the top and bottom are inconsistent, hard to make flattering

RTR please include notes on how to properly knot this dress for people like me who are clueless when it comes to wrap dresses and proper knots. This dress has gorgeous colors and when tied correctly I'm sure it drapes beautifully but I could not master it. In my husband's words he couldn't tell if I was in doctor scrubs or a robe. It comes with two massive panels of fabric that are very daunting (to me at least). Godspeed, I hope the next person can figure out how to rock this. Would be so fun for a vacation or warm weekend getaway.

The perfect dress for small-business Saturday shopping in the summer. Lots of compliments. Love the material. Feels rich. I moved with ease. Much different look from my tighter rentals but I loved the look overall!
I couldn't get this to tie so that there isn't a ton of the under fabric showing or the tie was loose and it looked awful
Awesome fit, great for hot weather.

links_reviews_title: So flattering! Perfect for work but also a great dress just to throw on for the weekend
links_reviews_text: This dress was great for my work trip to Australia, it was casual and light enough for the warm summer weather, but the button up / collar look made it still professional enough. It is a very light, silk material so it does wrinkle but it steams easily enough and the tie front hides a lot. I was worried that it was going to be confusing to wear based on other reviews but it's pretty straight-forward to tie (just take the two corners and tie together) and then adjust based on the look you are going for.

Rented my size (10) - this was huge! So much fabric tying it just made me look gigantic. Size down for sure. I thought the knot might camouflage my tummy...I was very very wrong. Super cute in theory!

links_reviews_title: Amazing dress and super fun to wear top is large so deff size down
links_reviews_text: Amazing dress and super fun to wear top is large so deff size down

links_reviews_title: I honestly wish I could buy this dress
links_reviews_text: As others have said, the tie is a bit odd BUT that wasn't what surprised me. It's the fact that there isn't any specific tie on either side of the dress to tie. It's just basically a tent's worth of flowing fabric. I found it surprisingly difficult to pair with shoes. However, it is SO comfortable. I'm debating buying this one because I love it so much.

links_reviews_title: I loved this dress and was able to style if forward or backwards
links_reviews_text: It was very loose fitted

links_reviews_title: Such a great dress. It was light so great for the warm weather.
links_reviews_text: I got a lot of compliments.

links_reviews_title: Great for everyday lounging, the pool, or even dressed up - Truly for ANYTHING.
links_reviews_text: I'm...truly obsessed with this little number. When I first got it, I had no idea what to think - I didn't know how to tie it, or how to nail the look. But then I found myself wearing it....literally everywhere. The beach, to work, lounging around the house, running errands. The top is formal and chic enough to wear to work, the bottom is casual and loungy enough to wear around. The only con is that the fabric is a little thin so if you have rumples in the bum region, you might want to wear spanx, or just embrace it!

I read the reviews and thought that perhaps I can figure out a way to style this dress because I love the color palette and style but unfortunately it is pretty impossible to make this dress look flattering.

It's a little confusing to wear, but once you get it on, its so chic and different. I ended up rolling the sleeves too because they were a little long, but I would totally rent again. I got a lot of compliments.

Just like everyone else, I have no idea how to tie this dress. It runs huge first of all. There is no belt. Just two giant pieces of extra, triangle shaped fabric on each side that you have to try to knot together. Top half looks like some sort of work uniform since it runs so large. Bottom half looks like a beach wrap. Returning.
I loved the colors and material but there's not enough fabric to tie a flat knot. Still cute but a little awkward fitting
I have a similar Vince coat in grey that I love. This one is amazing too. Runs a bit large. You can wear with casual jeans and sneakers, but feel amazingly put together.
Nice coat but not lined. Looks great and is fine so long as the temps are not single digit.
I wore this with a hoodie underneath or a turtleneck. It fit my hips and I actually used the hood. Didn't feel like a robe but I probably would've sized down one size.
Totally elegant, understated coat - color is a beautiful navy. Sort of a wide, slouchy fit. Kept me warm at around 40 degrees outside.

links_reviews_title: Very roomy - perfect for wearing over blazer
links_reviews_text: Loved this coat. Roomy enough to layer. Easily could have sized down
A little itchy from the wool but very well made and wonderful VINCE quality. Loved that it has a hood as it rains or drizzles in the PNW. Great coat for layering. Received several compliments.

links_reviews_title: I feel a little like Mary Kate and Ashley, all the love intended
links_reviews_text: An oversized fit which totally works. Despite it's enveloping size and woolen material it's not for the coldest of conditions... the wool is somewhat thin and there's just one button to keep it closed. With the right outfits it looks amazing and with others it kind of has a bathrobe aesthetic. The hood is fun, and I found myself wearing it up occasionally while walking my dog and pretending I was monk.

Beautiful coat. Not good for petite ladies. I have the M and its very generous. I could have possibly worn the small but my arms a very long. It's a great coat for moderate weather as it is not lined and the wool is not super thick. Pretty navy color and plenty of room to accommodate chunky sweaters.
Cute blazer, I liked the print. I have bigger arms, so the sleeves weren't as comfortable as I would like them to be, but didn't bother me too much.

links_reviews_title: Loved this blazer! It looked like a million bucks with jeans and a tank!
links_reviews_text: It was a little stiff but surprisingly comfy!

I wore this with a lacy tank, black coated denim jeans, and heels for date night and medium wash jeans and loafers for a daytime, business casual look. I got a ton of compliments and adored this rental.
Feel tailored made for me. I'm obsessed with this blazer! Obvi needs a top underneath. This was me trying it on as soon as I got it. I will be renting this one on repeat.
Loved the muted colors of this jacket. It was very neutral and the fit was great. A little snug across the check but I am a 34 DDD. My husband told me I looked like a rock star.
This jacket was so easy to pop on. It's black and goes with just about anything. Wore it to work and it kept me warm.
Really cute blazer. Easily dressed up or down.

I am petite with a short torso, small waist and large hips, I have the hardest time finding a blazer to fit. This fit a little large in the shoulders and a little small in the hips, but overall the fit was flattering if I didn't keep it buttoned. I was surprised that the blazer was denim material - but you can't tell unless you touch it. I dressed this up a little with a sliver sparkly sweater and sequins pants. This blazer was really fun to wear and could be dressed up or easily dressed down!

I loved how easy it was to wear this blazer. I wore simple black pants and a black top, and the blazer was enough to dress the outfit up for work. It fit a little large and the material was thinner than expected. If I rent again, I'd probably size down for a more tailor fit.
Love this, great fit, but the arms were a little short for my tall body, so I just rolled them up. Rented to wear with a dress for a conference, but like it with jeans better.

links_reviews_title: Rented for work or date night.
links_reviews_text: Fit like a glove. I have broad shoulders and sometimes sleeves can feel tight on my arms. This blazer fit me beautifully - love it!
This jacket is just so classy. I wore it over a velvet jumpsuit for a charity event and it really felt formal enough to wear to a cocktail party. The pattern is subtle but gorgeous.
This jacket is really beautiful. It's tailored with a beautiful fabric and pattern. I wore it to work and then out for an event and loved it!
Loved the look and feel of this jacket. But there are no pockets, which is a total downside for me. Loads of compliments, looks beautiful. Did I mention no pockets?
Jacket feels good, like a sturdy yet soft denim. Super cute but ran big. I will try the next size down.

links_reviews_title: In person it looked like a jacket from the 80s so I never wore it.

links_reviews_text: Favorite blazer this winter, by far!!
Really enjoyed this blazer and received lots of compliments. Would definitely rent again. Comfortable and true to size. Love the uniqueness about it.
It's nicely tailored and looks expensive.
Very versatile. Paired with jeans, pants and over a gray dress. Wrinkles are not a problem.

links_reviews_title: lovely coat with stiff, wide shoulders
links_reviews_text: This jacket's material is lovely, thick and somewhat stiff. It fit me well through the bust, waist, hips and sleeve length but the shoulders were a bit big. I generally like structured shoulders because mine are narrow but these were just a bit too large for me. A shame because it really is a beautiful jacket. You could dress it down with jeans or wear it to work or out for the evening. I usually wear a 18w or 20w, bra size 38 H. I ended up wearing it out for a night to the movies but was hoping to wear to work.

I rented an xl but could have probably rented a large. I ended up wearing it dressed down with dark jeans on vacation and got lots of compliments. I would really love to buy this. Will probably rent again for work in the smaller size to go with a black dress. My favorite RTR rental so far!

links_reviews_title: Sophisticated. Good for work, evening out, etc.
links_reviews_text: Pros: Classy print Cons: Stiff material.

links_reviews_title: A tad bit boxy and folded a strange way when sitting with it buttoned.
links_reviews_text: A tad bit boxy and folded a strange way when sitting with it buttoned.
fits great
This blazer fit perfectly. I wore a white cami and jeans, which is a pretty casual outfit, and paired that with this blazer to dress it up. Received multiple compliments!
What a gorgeous blouse. When I put this on I felt like a princess! Beautiful quality, beautiful style, just beautiful!
This fit true to size, the little sparkle was itchy but I love the tie in the back!
The fabric is thicker than it appears in the photos and it has a gold thread going through it. Top is perfect for early fall or spring weather.

While the shirt is really cute, you really need to wear a pair of tight fitting pants so that the shirt doesn't make you look bigger than you are. The baby doll structure of the shirt is cute, but it can be a little body looking. I like it for a cute casual look, but didn't feel super flattering.

I liked this shirt, but it did fit very loosely. In pictures, I looked a lot larger than I am. But the fabric made up for the shape shortcomings. It's full of color with thin gold thread interwoven to create a subtle sparkle. Loved that.

I wore this for work, and I'm glad I rented because the neck is SOOOOOO itchy after about 3-4 hours. The tie at the back of the neck is really cute, and I love the vibrant colors. This shirt is eye-catching, but it's probably not the most flattering cut on me. I think it made me look a little wide, but as I rented it, it was fun for the day!!

Cute! Flowy and great for camouflaging that mid section. A cute stand out piece for a nice spring day. Although roomy, it's a little fitted around boobs so you may want to stick to your true size especially if you're full busted. It has a fun color pattern however I was expecting it to stand out more or maybe be brighter per reviews. Not so vibrant in my opinion maybe because of several dry cleanings.... Would however rent again.
The fabric has a subtle shine to it, which is so fun. I love the high neckline. Very comfy!!

links_reviews_title: Pretty But Not Flattering On Me
links_reviews_text: I love the details, the sparkle and the mixed patterns. But the blouse added weight to my small frame. It wasn't flattering on me. It runs large but is tight in the arms. I feel like this piece belongs on the tall and willowy model. It's really pretty.

Wouldn't buy this if I saw it in store but enjoyed the rental! This has some sparkle to it which I wasn't expecting from the photo. I sized down from medium to small. Pretty sure either would have worked but small fit perfect. Would rent again!
This blouse was way too long on me. Would have been perfect if shorter.

I wanted something vibrant and unique for my visit to the Taj Majal and this top met those requirements. The top travels well—no wrinkles. And the colors really pop. It’s hard to tell but there is good thread running through the top—an added detail that makes this top spectacular. I totally want to buy it!

was a little tight in the chest, but nothing uncomfortable, cute babydoll fit, easy to wear, little bit of sparkle in the fabric, well made item; it was a bit itchy after all-day wear (probably due to the sparkly fabric)

I really enjoyed this top but it is oversized and flowy so if that's not your vibe I would skip it. Fit TTS, maybe a touch tight in the chest but I have a larger chest and it didn't make the shirt fit poorly. Overall fun pattern and was great for a day walking around New Orleans.
I absolutely loved this- very different from my usual all black. Like most Opening Ceremony, it ran big, but didn't feel overwhelming to me. Would definitely rent again.
Perfect for a creative cocktail party or evening out with friends. It is quite large around the mid-section which is great for comfort, but not all that flattering. Could be a great maternity option.

links_reviews_title: Unique and comfortable - even in third trimester
links_reviews_text: Wore this at 29 weeks pregnant - went up one size and it had plenty of room. If you aren't super tall, this would work for all pregnant stages.
Cute but looked a little worn
It's really beautiful and has some shimmer to the fabric that's even better in real life!!
Pros: Colorful Cons: It's a little long, would have preferred it to cut shorter. Not a fan of the material.
It was cute but uncomfortable and restricting on arms and chest
Fun and beautiful. Material was light! Paired with jeans a little booties.
It was a little tight on my chest. But it's cute

links_reviews_title: Even though this was big, it worked for me
links_reviews_text: Wore his to a party where I needed to be comfortable chasing after kids. It was perfect. Beautiful colors and fabric!
Unwearably big and blousy.

The other reviewers are correct that this shirt is quite flowy on the bottom, but I wore it with tight white ankle length jeans and heels and it looked really cute. I love the colors and it has some sheen to it. I definitely recommend it as long as you don't mind flowy tops.

links_reviews_title: fun with jeans to a baseball game
links_reviews_text: cute top !
Cute top...definitely full at the bottom and maybe I tied it too tight but the shoulders were a little tight. Cute for dinner out with friends paired with jeans.
Top is super cute but flares at the bottom. Unfortunately it was not flattering on me.

links_reviews_title: I wore this during the day once and out to dinner the next night
links_reviews_text: The colors were extremely flattering

links_reviews_title: Great for work under a blazer
links_reviews_text: fits true to size, very flowy

links_reviews_title: Too long and too much fabric
links_reviews_text: Ended up not wearing. I love the neckline and shoulders but the midsection and hips need to be much shorter and more narrow to be remotely flattering.
There wasn't a good drape for me. But very pretty fabric. I didn't end up wearing it because I just couldn't make it work.
Fit was nice. Fun high-neckline. Loved the bow in the back. Pattern was unique!

links_reviews_title: Fun, feminine and colorful top that can be dressed up or worn casual with jeans.
links_reviews_text: There is a lot of material at the bottom of the shirt that can look bulky, but not terribly unflattering. There is a silk liner so you don't have to worry about it being too sheer.

links_reviews_title: Felt like I was wearing a mini tent
links_reviews_text: I love a good BoHo top, however this did not hit the mark. It was overall too wide. While I could have worn it With skinny jeans or cut off shorts and pulled it off I just didn't love it so I didn't wear it. The color combo is pretty however. What perhaps have looked better on a taller girl. I said it was true to size because it is meant to be oversized I do think it fit as it was intended but it was just too big for me.

This shirt probably looks flattering if you are waif thin like the model but at a size 6/8, it just didn't do much for me and it looked like a maternity shirt. Would not recommend. That being said, it's a high-quality blouse, just unflattering on me.

Cool shirt that's a little different than usual work attire. Had fun in it. I rented the medium because of other ratings, but I could have used a S - would have less of the "pregnancy look" vibe to it.
Loved the fit it was so comfortable and made me feel super cute! Wanted to keep it!
This shirt does an odd sort of ruching under the chest, so it can get a little snug, but other than that the pattern is super fun and I loved this! will rent again.
Love this dress! You can dress it down for brunch and walking around a city or you can dress it up with heels for a night out. Not too tight + is stretchy.
I wasn't expecting the dress to have shimmer but still liked it. Fabric is very forgiving. Length is perfect

Cute dress, very stretchy. I initially rented a large and needed to exchange for the medium. Frankly, if I rented again I would probably go down to the small. For reference I'm a pre-pregnancy pear shaped size 8, and was 32 weeks pregnant when I wore it. My biggest issue with the dress is that it hangs more than hugs, so it can make you look bigger than you are, especially if you're curvy. That said, the sparkles were super fun and color is great in person.

I was really excited to rent this! It's definitely sparkly in person! I pair it with sneakers and a denim jacket to give it a more casual look for every day, but I had a ton of compliments. I'm 5'4 and it hit perfectly mid calf. I could've sized down one I would say because the fabric is very stretchy. Overall love!
This was the perfect dress to wear to a NTE house party! Not too sexy but still run and shiny!
Very comfortable dress! It was perfect to enjoy sweater weather and still be cute. It runs a bit big, size down for a slimer fit.

First, this is stretchy and roomy. Size down. There were no reviews and I had just ordered two sweater dresses (both medium) that didn't fit so of course, ordered this in a large and it's huge. Arms were long. Roomy in the back. It's comfortable but there is a glittery thread.

links_reviews_title: Pretty, more metallic than the pictures looked.
links_reviews_text: Way too big, I am 5'10" and wear a size 6 usually.

links_reviews_title: Made me look pregnant :( . I do happen to have a party girl pouch though...
links_reviews_text: Only rent if you have abs

Realllllly wish I had read the reviews before ordering. The pictures look like it's two solid colors in the threading but it is actually shiny thread. Kind of tacky but I'm going to wear it anyway, could also be a little tighter so size down.
Pros: great color, shape, length Con: super thin, wore spanx tights under and still felt thin, might not work for curves
I rented this for work, but should have paid closer attention to reviews. Far too sparkly. Fit like a glove, but better for a date night.

links_reviews_title: Absolutely loveeeeee this dress. I received so many compliments on it. I got so much use out it.
links_reviews_text: Flattering to shape.
This was a great dress for work. It is a little glittery. The downside is that it is stretchy, so after you wear it, it stays a little bigger. Not a tight fit at all.
It's fancy and stylish but didn't work for my figure personally. It can be a good date night dress for nicer dinner.
This dress was ok to just wear around but I didn't love it. It was much more sparkly than I expected and a bit too big. I recommend sizing down. Didn't love or hate it
Thought I'd be able to wear this as a sweater dress to work but too many sparkles for a business casual setting. Also ran really big!

I really loved this midi dress! It was easy to dress up and down, plus it was incredibly comfortable. I wish I had ordered based on the letter size and not the coordinating numbers. I got an XL and it was very big (and I'm 7 months pregnant). I wore this 3 times and received lots of compliments. Fun dress for fall.
The neckline detail cheapens the dress. The thread is sparkly, I did like the length, but it runs large and was baggy. Didn't end up wearing.
Cute but doesn't give you any shape . More of a slouchy look. Totally recommend for someone thin Anyone that has curves it makes you look huge

I got this as a potential outfit for an event but figured I could wear it to work. I grabbed the large because it was available. Since it looks body con I I figured it would be ok. But it was huge! The fabric is very soft and not super clingy so get your size.
Didn't wear. I'm normally a small/medium in dresses. I rented medium at 30 weeks pregnant and felt like it was big. Though didn't love it to exchange. Returned unworn

I love Scotch and Soda - and this lived up to their funky style. The fit was TTS - I am a 0/2 and ordered an XS. Collar added very cute detail. A few things to note: the shimmer is a bit much for work. It seem much more tame in the photo. And the color + ribbed look made this dress truly unforgiving. Even on a slim figure. Overall: Rent for drinks/happy hour and wear Spanx.
This dress was gorgeous. Runs a tad small, size up especially if you're curvy. No stretch to this at all. Love the neckline! Length is below the knee
Love the print with the pops of red and yellow. For like a glove. No stretch though but it worked. Was gonna wear it to work but ended up wearing it for date nite. Great rental!
This is a great design. I almost purchased, but I had some issues with the hem towards the end of the day.
Great work dress - pleating in the neckline was unique and it was so kind to my shape. Felt like a boss in this!

links_reviews_title: Absolutely flattering! Turn heads for sure!
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress for work and it was not tight but not loose.

This dress fit a bit strangely. Tight in the middle so had to size up from my normal 4. Long skirt, better for really tall gals. Nice halter neck / turtleneck, but my hair kept getting caught in the hook at the neck.

I LOVE this dress! True to size. Has some stretch so it's surprisingly comfortable! Falls just below my knees and I'm tall, so I think it may work better on taller women. So many people complimented me on the dress. Went from day to night effortlessly. Wore with black pumps.
Lived it. Was a little small on my but runs fairly true to size.
I loved the neckline on this dress. It's simple and modest, which worked perfectly for the event I attended.

links_reviews_title: My curves made it not for work
links_reviews_text: Such a great work to date dress! It was a little tight on me, but that's super common. I threw a leather jacket on and paired it with black booties. I'm a 4 top, 8 bottom and I say this runs like a true size 6. I think I'll try the 8, but I imagine it will be too large on top.

Nice, flattering design. Good professional length, if you're tall. Fabric was a high quality light wool. The pattern was a nice black and white tweed with some subtle red and yellow accent stripes. Will definitely rent again.

I absolutely love this dress! Great way to show off your great arms, love the length, professional and feminine. Split in the back (and not too high), this is a winner. Careful sitting down and not choking yourself, the high neck is quite tailored, but that's an easy work-around. Wore it a ton of times and got a ton of compliments!

Perfect fall work dress! I'm generally between a size 6 and 8, but I always order an 8 for work dresses to avoid being too tight... the 8 fit perfectly! Super stylish neckline, and the length of the dress looks very flattering on tall girls (I'm 5'11)! Plus, no issue with the slit in the back of most dresses being too high up. Would definitely rent again!
Loved this dress. Wanted to buy. The neckline is very sexy. Had to wear a cardigan for parts of work. Pinstripes were maroon and mustard yellow.

There's no doubt YOU are the boss in this power dress! A confidence booster. Was surprised by how much I liked the colors, photos don't do it justice. I liked it with a belt when wearing solo; if I wore a jacket or sweater I probably wouldn't belt it. Thicker material makes it perfect for between seasons. Had to wear a racer back bra, as the arm holes are cut a smidge too deep in the back to work with regular straps. It's a slim fit, and I wore light Spanx on my pear shape bottom to smooth things out. SO many compliments!! The only con, it arrived a wrinkled mess (wasn't shipped in a regular RTR garment bag, oddly) and I'm not great at ironing. And it did wrinkle a little from sitting. Which normally I hate; but this dress is so fab, it's worth putting up with a few minor wrinkles. Love it!
Super fun work dress. Form fitting but not inappropriately so. Be aware that it runs a bit tight in the neck, chest and arm holes. Still loved it.
fits TTS, hit me at my knee so may not work for people <5'6 really beautiful detailing, fabric is transitional for Fall. did feel uncomfortable on my neck after a 12+ workday.
