Weird fit, the t-shirt length underslip was extremely tight, yet the dress was loose me swimming in the top part. Just weird fit.
The fabric is very pretty, but the baggy fit was not flattering and made me look fat.

links_reviews_title: Good for a crazy hot day
links_reviews_text: So comfortable but you will look pregnant
Just surprised it's by Vince. It's fine, but just very heavy and not a dress I would ever wear in the summer.

Loved this fun and flowy dress. I'm tall so it hit at a great length and was super loose throughout the day which is great when you're moving and running around. There is a slit, which makes it a little sexy. It's very sheer so I wore black shorts underneath. The only thing I didn't like was the half lining which made the size feel smaller than it is, and it clung awkwardly around my boobs. Like, I rented this dress for something loose and comfy but chic, and this weird half lining (that stops at the top of yours stomach for some reason?) was awkwardly strangling my boobs all day. Anyway, it was bareable and I liked the dress otherwise.

links_reviews_title: The pleating makes this special and prevents it from looking basic.
links_reviews_text: Simple dress that flows dramatically. Cool. I do recommend wearing with shapewear on the bottom - the dress can "stick" in the wrong places sometimes.
It's a tent, but it's so chic and so pretty. I felt so comfortable. I added a tiny silk belt for some shape. Paired with a black blazer (for indoor office AC) and little black mules. Loved!

This dress is beautiful and flowy. It's perfect for a summer day at the office! Only slight issue is that they arm holes are a bit small, but I only say that so that if you are between sizes, go up. You can also have a lot of fun accessorizing this dress!

links_reviews_title: Can be worn to work or an event.
links_reviews_text: I wore this at 33 weeks pregnant and still had plenty of space to spare (pre-pregnancy size was a 6, but I got an L in this dress). Loose, but comfortable/flattering fit for a preggo! Would probably work in the final weeks of pregnancy, just as well as now. If I were my regular size, I'd probably size down to an S.
I rented this for work and it was way too fancy looking for my job as a teacher. Many people asked where I was going after work haha. It's so comfortable and looks so chic.

links_reviews_title: Lots of compliments on this dress. It was very beautiful and a great fit.
links_reviews_text: Great dress.

love this dress, it looks great, felt comfortable. I wore it for my sisters birthday lunch and for a day in the office. it is very voluminous, so it could be overwhelming on someone petite or feel like a maternity dress if you have any stomach issues. It's perfect for a tall pear shaped person like me!
This dress rules. Rent it.
Flowing, not oversized.

links_reviews_title: Eh, it's a fine dress. Not my favorite.
links_reviews_text: It's not good for big boobs - there's like a tight under layer just in the chest part that makes it fairly uncomfortable.

The dress itself is pretty, but unfortunately it wasn't flattering for me right now. I am 20 weeks pregnant, and while there was plenty of room for my bump- the volume didn't do me any favors. I think the dress may be beautiful if you are tall and slender.
love VINCE but this was just odd - not very flattering - overly voluminous

links_reviews_title: Love this dress. Very versatile and got lots of complements.
links_reviews_text: Wore it with slouchy booties and a fun RTR fitted jean jacket. This is a dress I'd like to buy. The only problem is tThe arm holes run small on this dress, and the neck is quite high (especially when sitting down), so it'd not as comfortable as I would have thought. I would go up a size.

Its hard to tell from the pics, but this def runs on the more casual side. I wore it to a music festival with tennis shoes and a jean jacket. It was perfect. I would absolutely rent this again. I am an hourglass 12 5'4 and the fit was great. The only minor thing was the dress comes with a string/rope belt of the same fabric (not sure how else to describe it) and that was not included in the shipment which was fine bc I probably wouldn't have worn it anyway.
Wore this with gold jewelry and fancy heeled sandals to the theater and it was so comfortable and so cute. Pleats fall beautifully. Pockets!! It'll be hard to return it.

At first I thought this dress was ridiculous and oversized but I decided to wear it anyway. It grew on me quickly. It moves so nicely and is incredibly comfortable. I received so many compliments on it. I would totally rent again.

Nice details like slits and pockets (!!!) that aren’t noticeable in the photo. Nice movement. Several compliments. If you have a larger cup size don’t make the mistake I did of sizing down. There is a top liner that only goes to the stomach that is very fitted and not stretchy at all.

links_reviews_title: Great dress but tight in arm area
links_reviews_text: I normally need to size down in Vince so got the XS vs my usual Small but should have gone for my regular size here as it was REALLY tight right under the arms. Just ordered the Small and hope that works out bc it's a beautiful dress.

This dress does not have much body or shape to it. However it just works for some reason. It's fitted at the neck and chest. The waist and body is dramatically a-lined. The pleats give it an elegant swing. It's unique and chic enough to wear to a mod wedding. Also perfect for a date night look. I did not want to give this dress back.

I loved this look. It fits like a glove and it is modest and sexy all at the same time. The only part i did not like is the sleeves needing to be flipped back in to place often but this was so nice and warm and comfortable.

links_reviews_title: When I walk out in it, my boyfriend's jaw dropped. He loved it!
links_reviews_text: My favorite part is the fabric is thick so there's no under garment lines and you can't see through the fabric. It's very comfortable and soft. Most XS dresses are usually still too big for me, but this one was perfect. Not too tight and not too loose. I'm 5'6" and 115lbs with long legs. Great with flat boots and heels. I wore it to work and to a Valentine's party with friends. Great dress!
Conservative enough to wear to work. unique design and fits well. wish the waist could be a little more fit.

links_reviews_title: Very comfortable and easy to wear
links_reviews_text: I thought this dress was super cute, definitely body-con but you could wear it with shape wear. Sleeves were the right length and fabric had comfortable stretch. Buttons are real so could come unbuttoned if the dress fit very tightly.
Cute and funky!

links_reviews_title: Comfy stretch knit but also nice!
links_reviews_text: Loved this dress! Felt a little Morticia Adams inspired but was great since I wore it in a October. Was a fun dress.
This dress is AMAZING!!!....it fit very well and material was nice and light. I received soooooo many compliments on my dress! It fit my body like a glove! Perfect in all the right places!
The fit was perfect. Very fitted around the top and it wasn't tight around the waist or butt area. I had a lot of compliments throughout work. I love this style.
Too loose at the waist and too tight around the butt, so it wasn't flattering and ended up not being able to wear this anywhere.

18 weeks pregnant - 2nd pregnancy at about 110 lbs and looking like I'm a first time pregnant at 28 weeks for a petite person) - fabric has stretch, dress is really nice and good for a winter event. The neck is definitely small but I was able to get the xs on still , which I'm glad because the size Small wasn't form fitted enough for me. Received many compliments.

links_reviews_title: Odd fit - Not good for hourglass figures.
links_reviews_text: It had potential - if it fit correctly, it would have been a nice dress. The waist was big, the chest was tight, the sleeves were extra long and looked as if I was a child trying on my dad's clothes, and I have long arms! Such a bizarre fit. Normally dresses fit me as they're intended. This feels cheaply structured - like a cheap clothing store item made in China. The proportions are way off. This might be for the woman who has a hard time finding sleeves that don't end above the wrist, and doesn't have large bust and possibly a straighter body time.

The dress needs to have a zipper - the neck line was so hard to pull over your head - I should had gotten one size up so it would fit as tight. I would never wear this dress to work its supper fitted maybe for a date night.
Such a flattering cut and pattern, I got so many compliments. Coworkers were telling me I should buy the dress straight up.
The fit was great and the dress is really cute. Collar is a bit tight though
Fit was great and material was nice and kept me warm

links_reviews_title: I felt so good in this dress and i got so many compliments on it!
links_reviews_text: The material is good for slender or curvy women so any body type can wear it.
liked it
Not for larger busts and hit my curves in funky spots
Super cute and not skin tight! Wore to work and got tons of compliments.
heavy fabric which hugs body nicely
Perfect winter work dress. I'm petite so it was long on me, but thAts how I wanted it to be anyway.

This was a disappointment, I could not get the dress on over my head because the neck hole was too small. For reference I always buy kids baseball hats, thus it's not like I have a large mellon head:).

I got this dress for every day, but I could barely fit it over my head. It runs small around the neck and shoulders, then was rather loose around the waist and belly. May be a good choice for somebody who's thicker around the waist and has a tiny head.
Loved it
Love this blazer! Sexy and versatile.
Love love love this! So fun and trendy for a work event or dinner. True to size.

Loved this blazer. The leather sleeve makes it perfect to transition from work to happy hour. The cut of the sleeve is angled which is also a fun detail. The green color was perfect to wear during the holiday season as well. The 10 fit but was a bit snug in the chest area and not that comfortable buttoned up but it worked.

Love this jacket! Such a statement piece that you'll get so many compliments on! Definitely size up. Especially for the arms. I'm traditionally a 4-6 but I sized up to an 8 based on reviews and it fit perfectly

I wore this with both a turtle neck and a black lace tank underneath and loved both looks. The sleeves are three quarter length though. It didn't really look right wearing long sleeves underneath, but I just rolled them up. Looked great with black jeans and light jeans. Definitely size up for a perfect fit.

links_reviews_title: Perfect blazer for Bret Michaels concert
links_reviews_text: I work as a DJ at a radio station and needed to look rocker yet professional for a Bret Michales concert. This blazer was amazing and so comfortable to move in. Fit perfectly and I got tons of compliments. Would look fab with jeans, I wore with leather leggings.
Love this jacket, fit nicely. Was a little hard to style
Fit well and sleeves were really fun. Size was perfect and definitely dressed up my denim day at work!

links_reviews_title: Super cute but cut for a smaller frame
links_reviews_text: This jacket is adorable. My husband loved it and the color is awesome. However, the shoulders are narrow and the arms pretty small. The leather loosens up a bit on the arms as the day goes on. If you have mace broad shoulders or bigger arms, you might want to size up for comfort.

links_reviews_title: Super Cute Jacket, but Didn't Get to Wear It Outside my House
links_reviews_text: The jacket is super cute and I originally rented it for a concert, but wasn't able to wear it outside the house with the COVID-19 restrictions. I think it runs pretty true to size and it was very comfortable. Will probably rent again once we can all leave our houses again.

links_reviews_title: Wish I'd gone w the 6 instead of 8
links_reviews_text: Rtr suggested I get an 8 even though I'm usually 6. So I got the 8 and it's a bit big. Should have sizes down. Kind of a Star Trek-y vibe but cool. My husband, who is not a Trekkie haha thought it looked sexy. It s shorter in the back.
Love this blazer! Great slimming fit!
Super cute, wore it to a friends birthday party. I sized up because I have broad shoulders and this fit me perfectly.
Great fit super cute and can be worn formally or casually.
This piece was the perfect amount of edgy while still being totally perfect for work and everyday wear, I loved wearing this!
Length is shorter and perfect for high waisted jeans.

links_reviews_title: Wore this with black skinny jeans to work felt so hip with the leather sleeves!
links_reviews_text: Loved the olive color and fit of this jacket. I am chesty and this jacket buttoned perfectly without gapping.

links_reviews_title: Unique blazer to spice up my work outfit
links_reviews_text: Great for work, but was slightly larger than expected
Really flattering staple piece for work. Would definitely rent again.

I really liked this jacket. It has an edgy professional look to it that spices up a normal work outfit. It has a very flattering cut to it, but the sleeves were a bit tight and restricted the range of motion in my arms a little bit. The leather is a great touch tho. I got a bunch of compliments on it

links_reviews_title: Work everyday wore with black pencil skirt
links_reviews_text: I really liked it. I would rent again- it is tight when you first put on in back/ shoulders but loosens up
Love the fit for my body type
Super cute and flattering!

links_reviews_title: Perfect detail to make an outfit special
links_reviews_text: I got so many compliments in this I ended up buying it! It looked incredible on, is extremely comfortable, matched everything I paired it with, and works for so many types of occasions. Highly recommend, I love it!
Wore to work and also out for dinner. Super cute and great green color! Very good quality.
good shape. perfect fit.

links_reviews_title: Pop of leather on the sleeves makes it a "eye catcher". The olive/black combo alone is a plus for me
links_reviews_text: Fit is true to size. Short cut blazer.
Looked cute when unbuttoned, but fit snug across my chest when I tried to button it.
way too small on arms and chest, go up a size!

I love this blazer! I wore it to work with a black turtle neck underneath, black jeans and paired with black flats. It was fitted but not to the point of discomfort, I was still able to move around in it. I felt super professional but not overdressed. It's the perfect piece to throw on over a basic outfit to make yourself stand out from the usual! The leather sleeves really pop as something unexpected. I would totally consider buying this!
Love this jacket. The color is great. Over all fit was good. A little big in the busy for me. If I would have got a for the body may have fit prefect but arms may have been too tight
This sweater is such a beautiful blue color. It's oversized, which I loved, and was super comfy. It has a slit up one side FYI!
Great with leggings for a cozy, comfy look
This was a nice chunky sweater although I didn't love the side slit which made my shape a little funny looking
Feeling fine with winter, but this vibrant, thick sweater in a flettering length was a good pick-me-up. Just right with skinny leggings or boots, and the slit in one side adds some interest.

links_reviews_title: SO COZY also the color is gorgeous
links_reviews_text: Rented this for a winter weekend in Vermont and wore at home as well. So comfortable. It was pretty long on my 5'3 frame but it still looked really cute and the slit in the side made it less stuffy. I got a ton of compliments.

links_reviews_title: The Best Kind of Winter Blues
links_reviews_text: This sweater is lovely! It's a gorgeous shade of blue. I loved how cozy the sweater was. It was on the longer side on me (slightly below mid-thigh), but the slit went up to just about perfectly at my waist to help give it some dimension on my frame. I would certainly rent this darling sweater again!
I loved the sweater! I loved the oversized feel and look. The size small for me fit perfectly and it went well with leggings and my little white boots. I'll definitely rent again!

Loved this oversized sweater. Probably could have gone with a medium, but went full blown OVERSIZED and loved it. Originally rented it for a weekend in Portland Maine. Wore it with jeans and tall brown boots. Ended up lovely the neckline so much I wore it again as more of a casual look (pictured) with leggings.
I've been living in this oversized sweater. Gorgeous color and the fabric is soft and lovely. I may have to buy this!

Just started getting chilly where I am located and I was so excited to try a sweater from RTR! This was THE most comfortable sweater I have ever worn. I loved it so much and wore it 3 times. To a listening party, work and a bookstore event. I also got compliments from women and men on the quality and color. I was intending to wear this as a dress, but couldn’t get away with it due to my height and the slit on the side, which came to the top of my hip! Therefore, i wore it with high waisted black leggings and booties. The neck fit perfectly and the sleeves were a perfect length for my long arms. I hate when sleeves barely reach to my wrist. If I’m able to buy before it’s gone, this will definitely be a Christmas gift to myself! Wish I could have this in every color possible for winter! - jasleigh
Wore this on a cold, rainy November day in NYC and it was perfect! Material is so soft and not itchy at all. Has a fun slot on the right side. Highly recommend.
Perfect oversized sweater - great fabric - warm - great color! A+

links_reviews_title: So comfy and soft, goes great with tight or jeans.
links_reviews_text: There's a log slit on the side and the cowl neck is soft and doesn't scratch your neck.

This sweater is oversized, so I ordered my usual size even though I'm 25 weeks pregnant. It fit great, was super comfortable and got me lots of compliments. The only thing I didn't love is that the slit is only on one side, so you need a tank or super high leggings underneath, and it hangs asymmetrically at the bottom. Will probably order it again though.

Loved the look and feel of this scrumptious sweater. Wore with leggings, jeans and adored it for several days. Considered buying it because of how comfortable it was to wear. Perfect for air travel. Will rent again!

I LOVE this sweater. So comfortable and soft, super cute slouchy long fit, love the oversize turtleneck, and the color is SO gorgeous. This one makes me feel glam even on a casual/lounge day. The split in the bottom hem was not a problem for me, thought it was a cute detail.
I didn't wear this. It was just a fail. The neck had too much fabric. It was not super soft. And it was just huge.

links_reviews_title: Great color and fit and super comfy!
links_reviews_text: I received so many compliments on the color. It fit perfectly, and it became my go-to comfy sweater. I frequently wore it with skinny jeans and tall black boots. In the end, I decided to purchase this piece.
Good

links_reviews_title: Husband loved this sweater on me.
links_reviews_text: Ran a bit large. Slit on the side made it very original.
Comfortable, oversized sweater! Nothing special but lovely color and good piece.
Love it so much, wore it all the time. I may or may not need to purchase next time around!! Worth it.

My favorite sweater of all time! the coziest thing ever! definitely runs large but if you know Free People most things are large in terms of sweaters. Perfect oversized look! If you are between a S and M and mostly use M I would get a S.
You can never go wrong with Free People. Just remember their products are typically over sized so size down
It fit true to size but ran a little big.

links_reviews_title: Super cozy and the perfect oversized sweater!
links_reviews_text: Love the side slit!
Cute with jeans and heals

I ordered a medium in the sweater (even though I'm usually a small), I was worried it wouldn't fit however it was perfect. Nice and oversized and it looked great with leggings and booties. The sweater was in great condition and I was very happy with the item.

I kept this item for a quite a while and wore it multiple times both in the workplace as well as to casual outings. I loved the bright blue color and got many compliments on it. It's extremely comfy and not unflattering at all despite it being an over-sized sweater. There's a slit up one side that goes up to the top of your pants, so I recommend wearing it with a tank underneath if you're going to be out somewhere with a cold breeze.
Huge, cozy, easy breezy. Throw it on and walk out the door. Dress it up or down. doesn't matter. Blue eyes get bonus points.
I wore this 3-4 times. One time I wore it with black leggings and paired with black boots worked well for the office.
Big and flouncy. Everything you need for winter coziness and sophistication at the same time.

Was not too bulky on my small frame, beautiful color to compliment blue eyes. I didn't realize there was a large slit opening on one side however, so you need to plan to wear a tank under. Quite warm as well.
I was a little alarmed at how large and blue this sweater is when it first arrived, but I've worn it twice already, it's the coziest sweater ever! Soft and full, it's like wearing PJs!

links_reviews_title: Amazing color and material. So cozy!
links_reviews_text: You can tell right away that this is a high quality sweater. It's thick, warm, soft, and comfortable. The shade of blue is just bright enough for a unique pop of color. I didn't want to take it off!

One of my favorite sweaters I've ever tried. The color is awesome and the fit is like shown. So fun to wear with a ton of things. The slit on the side is high, but I just wore regular jeans and it looked good. Love this.
It's a little short but perfect for a daytime look!

links_reviews_title: Perfect shirt for an NYC gal
links_reviews_text: Elevate your basic white tee with this cute New York print. The fabric is a bit thin and itchy I will say.
Love this tee. I'm holding on to it for a bit, so easy to wear

links_reviews_title: New York City shirt in NYC! Comfy graphic T-shirt - likes it a lot.

links_reviews_text: This was so soft and looked lived in. The design was fun and it miraculously was not too tight on my broad shoulders! It's a bit cropped and I wore it tucked into a RTR skirt. I wouldn't buy (too $ and not special enough), but it made me happy and I might rent again.

links_reviews_title: Fun pop of design and color on a classic comfy tee
links_reviews_text: Hit right at the waist. Not sheer at all. Cute fun comfortable tee

links_reviews_title: @thanksitsrtr - I HEART NY and this shirt
links_reviews_text: How cute is this ?!?! 10/10 design, 10/10 babydoll tee fit - see what else i loved on @thanksitsrtr

I understand Re/Done's aesthetic is about revamping vintage classics but my t-shirt arrived with off-color armpits and what looks like a dye stain near the collar. I couldn't wear it out. Otherwise, it's still a cute graphic and it fit great, just disappointed that it was significantly dirty compared to the uploaded photos.

links_reviews_title: Wish I could buy so cute and soft!

links_reviews_text: Love this t-shirt! Wore it knotted with high waisted jeans and skirts. Really cool design.
Paired with black jeans and heels for work and with boyfriend jeans for the weekend. Perfect tee.

I wore this a few times and it definitely stretched out (particularly at the neckline) after the first 2 wears. I absolutely love the playful pattern and got lots of compliments on it. Wore it partially tucked into high-waisted jeans with a blazer and lots of necklaces for work. I'm really picky about t-shirts and this was almost perfect. I'll probably rent again in my usual M. L was all they had and sometimes in t-shirts I size up to get a more relaxed fit but this was maybe a bit too relaxed since it's such a soft, stretchy cotton. I would've bought if it were cheaper.

links_reviews_title: I did not wear this because it's extremely short and not like the pictured model.
links_reviews_text: I did not wear this because it's extremely short and not like the pictured model.

links_reviews_title: Great fit, colorful graphic NYC tee.
links_reviews_text: I wore this several times over Labor Day weekend and received lots of compliments. Fit true to size and I loved that it was a short tee - not cropped but short.

links_reviews_title: Too low cut for my comfort
links_reviews_text: This dress is great for day time travel; comfy, relaxed material. The v neck was just too low for my comfort level.
Such a cute and easy option.
I loved everything about the fit of this dress, I could wear it daily :)
Perfect little dress for vacation! Wore on every travel day between countries since it is light and soft fabric while still looking chic. Would rent again!

Super cute dress, bottom fit great but... the top was teeny! Anyone with anything bigger than and A cup will need some double stick tape or be ready to wear this with a bra. Attempted to wear this bra-less and had a "wardrobe malfunction" moment. Would make a perfect bathing suit cover up

This dress is super comfortable and can be dressed up or down. I usually wear an 8 to 10 in dresses and got this in a medium. The top was a little big so I had to wear something underneath (plus I'm a 34DD) but I would not go down a size because the bottom was TTS. The straps were also kind of long and kept moving so without the bralette, there'd definitely be some sneak peeks. There's a little snap closure on the skirt that helps to keep the skirt closed when sitting or on windy days, which is helpful. I wore this dress all day from errands to dinner at night, on a warm day, but stayed cool and looking cute (I think). Overall, a nice simple dress to rent on a summer weekend day when you've got lots to do and no time to go home and change.

links_reviews_title: Not flattering for pear shaped women
links_reviews_text: I am curvy on my bottom half and usually wears an 8/10. This dress made my bottom half look huge with the way it wraps and the pockets. Didn't wear it

links_reviews_title: Good quality low low low cut so get ready
links_reviews_text: Quality was a nice stretch jersey material. Ran a bit small under my armpits but would have been fine. I have a small chest hit still wouldn't feel comfortable wearing it for my purposes. Maybe a vacation.
This is the perfect dress. It's comfortable and easy. Low v neckline, which meant I had to wear a black bralette but that did the trick. If I had less curves I would have skipped the bra.

links_reviews_title: Cute but too small and confusing how to wrap
links_reviews_text: Cute dress but tight around the middle and I took a while to figure out how to wrap it
The v is deeeeeep, so either need to wear something under or just be ready for the girls to be out. The fabric is super soft.
I didn't wear dress because it's incredibly low cut, particularly for a casual jersey wrap dress.

Absolutely loved the fit. The cut is sexy but not too much. The level at which the dress ties is very flattering. I wore it at work with casual shoes but can also wear it out at night with heels. It goes with everything in my closet

I will have to try this dress in a medium! The top was surprisingly tight over the shoulders. It's generally a narrow dress, though it is flowy. It's low cut but looks cute with a black bra underneath.
Gorgeous, simple and sexy!!

links_reviews_title: So comfortable so flattering. I never want to take it off!
links_reviews_text: Stretchy jersey material that you tie as tight or loose as you'd like. I've already worn in 3 times this week, might not give it back!

links_reviews_title: Made me a fan of teddy coats
links_reviews_text: I've never like the teddy coat trend, but this bomber made me obsessed with them! I got this coat to try out the trend without having to commit, and I am now looking to purchase my own.
Lovely soft fluffy fabric/color. Thin, not warm...warmth of a sweatshirt. Loved the neck wrap part.

This faux fur made me feel like a queen! The attached scarf is fun for an added flair. I found it paired well with a top and jeans or over a dress. The green color went with a lot as well. It doesn't fit snug, but it was comfortable and would fit another sweater underneath if it was cold!
Super cute and comfortable to wear all night or as a light jacket, the attached scarf gave it an extra oomph.
Cute. Fur a bit worn but still really Liked it.

links_reviews_title: It was a great jacket to wear with casual or formal
links_reviews_text: Fits boxy and short
I loved the deep green color and it is so soft. The tie makes it whimsical. Pretty wide through the waist.
great!
Loved this jacket so much. Perfect for dressing up or dressing down. So cozy and warm, great sized pockets, fit true to size. Love the scarf as an added embellishment also

I picked this gem up at a RTR store last minute before a trip to NYC. It was a stunning addition to my wardrobe. A classy, statement piece that I wore out on a date night as well as to the office + HH.
Rented this for the weekend in NYC and I love it so much! Perfect for fall and could go from day to night very easily. Not too warm and love the attached scarf. Got a lot of compliments on it!

I received the jacket new with tags. I order the medium I'm 5'8" and it hit me at the waist about an inch above my hips. The sweater I had on hung below it. It just didn't look good on me maybe with a tucked in shirt? Anyway it looks cute with the scarf tied but it doesn't hang well when it isn't tied so unless you plan on wearing it to an outdoor event you wouldn't be able to wear it at a club or party if the room was cold it just looks off.
Loved this. You'll probably want a nude colored tank to wear under it because of the holes...

I paired this sweater with a Tibi skirt for one of my favorite RTR unlimited outfits to date. It's a striking color. My one issue was the size; since it's cut boxy and an oversized look I recommend to size down

Cozy and warm, if a little boxy. This sweater is a stunningly gorgeous color. My only issue was that it was a little shapeless and didn't look all that cute in pictures. Small price to pay for being warm and comfortable.

links_reviews_title: Super long arms and oversized but loved
links_reviews_text: Was too big but I still wore it twice! So cute and the color is super interesting/fun
I got lots of compliments on the beautiful color of this sweater. Definitely oversized. I typically wear a small, but the XS was perfect.
Loved this sweater! I'm a 6 and the medium was nice and roomy. The knit was soft and cozy.

I love the material of this sweater for New England weathers - it's pretty thick. I am short (5'2") and the sleeves are a big too long on me, but I marked it as "true to size" given my height isn't average. The other thing is the holes on the front can be a little awkward for work, since some are around the chest area, so I suggest considering a tank top to wear under it. All in all, I'd buy this sweater if it was within my price range. For now, I can enjoy being warm and getting compliments for it.

Fantastic cold-weather sweater - very thick and warm, and the mock/funnel neck is perfect for total warming coverage without being too bulky. The color is beautiful, although IMO it doesn’t look nice with typical denim so gray or black or white pants/jeans are best. It’s very comfortable and soft. True to size and a bit oversized, but not crazy long - I wouldn’t call it cropped, but it’s more of a “standard” length than an extra-long length. The knit is chunky and there is a pretty set of diagonal open knit stitches on the front and on the arms - this may bother the very modest as you can somewhat see your bra through a couple of the holes.

High quality. Need to wear a dark undershirt as my white one showed through the stitching. Very cozy. A little tight at neck getting it on so be cautious if you already put on make up. Gorgeous color. Weekend ski vibe achieved.
Fits great, really soft, good quality
The color is a beautiful dark turquoise and is thick and warm. However the fit is overly large and boxy.
Amazingly thick, soft and warm. It's a great cold weather sweater. The color is rich, the style is modern and the quality is top.

links_reviews_title: Soft, well made, and a great color!
links_reviews_text: I knew this sweater would be high quality, but thought it would be boring; I was so wrong! The fit is exceptional so it wears with a sophistication I wasn't expecting, and the softness is remarkable. It's a deep teal, so the color, while not unique, is a color I don't usually wear so people complimented it all day. It's a beautiful sweater I highly recommend.
As advertised, this was an incredibly soft sweater. I wore it for several days on a cabin trip and it was warm and cozy, and the color was really beautiful in person (jewel teal). I would recommend!

The color on this is beautiful. It's very oversized. When I chose it, RTR gave me a medium, so I figured it may run small- this has been the case for a few items. It does not. The medium was very large on me. It's cozy! But I wouldn't be able to wear it to work. Great sweater for hanging on the couch on a cold day.
Looks nice and is cozy, maybe a little too warm as it gets into spring but will look to re-rent next year when it gets cold again.
I loved this sweater. Gorgeous color, really heavy, nice quality material. Got lots of compliments, would rent again
As others mentioned the sleeves were extra long. I rolled them up six inches to have them hit at my wrists. I love a boxy top but felt it was ran really large. Would rent again in a smaller size

links_reviews_title: Comfy and cute! I dressed it up for work and wore it with jeans for everyday.
links_reviews_text: Note that it is a relaxed fit, you can probably size down and still have it be comfy.
I wore this several times dressed up and down. Really versatile and a great color!

links_reviews_title: Soo cozy, but kind of large
links_reviews_text: This is a great sweater for a cold day, but is a bit oversized---and I love oversized. Not cold enough quite yet, but will probably rent again in a smaller size

links_reviews_title: This sweater is super cozy for a cool fall day.
links_reviews_text: Loved this sweater! Size up to get the over-sized sweater look.
Beautiful color and very chunky, cozy sweater. The arms are weird. This sweater is very warm as is not transitional.
The sweater is soft and felt really comfortable, but it was too big. I'll have to get it in a smaller size. Definitely size down with this one.
Too loose big. Never wore it.
Totally shapeless. The arms hung down six or seven inches below my fingertips. Not wearable.
Enjoyed this sweater and would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful color, terrific weave and material, unflatteringly baggy cut.
links_reviews_text: I typically like oversized tops and sweaters but this was oversized in the wrong places and created an unflattering shape. It consumed my 5'4" frame.
A little chunkier than I imagined. K don't have a super long neck, so it was like wearing a turtleneck. Not my best RTR experience
Too big and bulky, especially in the chest.

I really loved the color of this sweater. It was so cozy and looked great on! I gave 4/5 because it's starting to look slightly worn as sweaters tend to do after a season of wears, but still very cute!

This is a great warm sweater in a pretty color. It can be worn to work or casually. It is a keeper if you don't own this color blue in your closet. Looks nice with all browns, plaids and of course jeans.

The sweater was perfect for a rainy day. It's pretty casual, with extremely long sleeves and a boxy fit. I wore a shirt underneath since some of the holes from the knitted material were see through. It was very cozy - I felt like I was bundled up in a great way.
Oversized fit, comfy and cozy - but stylish vs frumpy. Beautiful color too. Recommend for sure.
Nice sweater, with a full look. It's very warm, which is a plus. The neck hole is a bit tight to pull over your head, but once it's on, it's comfortable. A bit heavy on the shoulders.
Fits slightly large, but comfy. easy to wear

links_reviews_title: Awesome color and so comfy. It does run large.
links_reviews_text: This sweater is great for a winter vacation or cold shopping day with a vest.
Very thick, quality sweater. It has some intentional holes in the stitching that may require a undershirt for some people. I love this sweater!

links_reviews_title: I wore this to work during our stormy weather.
links_reviews_text: The color of this sweater is beautiful. I got many compliments every time I wore it. The arms are long which I enjoyed. The style did have some piling when received.

I received this one new with tags and it was such a pleasure to wear on a freezing cold day with jeans and boots. The knit is very chunky thick and luxurious (you might be hot in it if the weather is in the mid 40s). The fit is oversized which is nice for a change with all the cropped tops everywhere. The color is also beautiful. Great rental!
Perfect for the occasion and looked brand new.

links_reviews_title: Ok! Fun but I won't rent again
links_reviews_text: I rent sunglasses all the time with RTR Unlimited. These were just okay. The fit was fine, the gold color was meh in terms of flattering my complexion. I wore for a whole week, but I wouldn't want to rent again.
I really like the shape and color of these. Honestly, they're just your average sunglasses. Cute for a day!

links_reviews_title: Fun and trendy frames with classic tortoiseshell accent
links_reviews_text: Very sturdy, comfortable fit. The gold was fun and the shape was perfect. The tortoiseshell finish on the earpieces is the perfect accent to the mirrored gold lens frames.

links_reviews_title: Cool & different but pretty beat up by the time I wore them
links_reviews_text: Love the matte gold frames & shape of these glasses. The frames were scratched & loose by the time I rented them. Guessing they were heavily worn all summer lol.
Fun glasses would have preferred eggshell but was a fun vacation piece
Wore these to a very fun day at a hot air balloon festival. They felt expensive and I liked how they looked. They did a good job protecting me from the sun too
These ran narrow and pinched my head. Did not wear. Looked well made but not as pretty in person as I'd hoped.

links_reviews_title: Never thought sunglasses could run small until now!
links_reviews_text: These were so insanely tight on my face I was scared they'd snap!
I love these! They are a pop of fun! I am seriously considering keeping them!
For tight/narrow on face. Fit and looked better on my 5-year-old.
LOVED the gold flashiness of these sunglasses. Perfect for the pool in Vegas. Got compliments from strangers :)

links_reviews_title: Cute with an Elton John vibe
links_reviews_text: Bigger than I thought

links_reviews_title: Would not stay on my nose
links_reviews_text: They're pretty heavy and kept slipping off.
This is my first accessory rental and they weren't scratched or damaged at all! They were a super fun addition!
These sunniest look great but are a bit heavy.
Not my look

links_reviews_title: Super cool but I felt like they made me look like I was trying too hard.
links_reviews_text: Fun
they aren't actually eggshell color. they are gold.

links_reviews_title: Got so many compliments, a bit funky, but very fun!
links_reviews_text: Thought they were a larger frame, but still fit well nonetheless

links_reviews_title: Great shape, but not the color I was expecting.
links_reviews_text: Thought these were cream colored glasses from the photo, not shiny gold !

They are great quality eye wear, but they would look much better on someone like Blake Lively with caramel highlights running through a very dark blonde/brunette colored hair. I was just too blonde for the gold plated front. There was not enough contrast
Fit perfectly tons of compliments!!

links_reviews_title: Runs very small but is amazing !!!!
links_reviews_text: Sexy her sporty. Perfect For white sneakers or dressed up So comfortable and flattering It has POCKETS! A bonus! However I am 5'3 118 32D wear a size 2 usually I read the reviews and ordered a 6 - it was still tight and buttons were pulling at chest so wore a cami Has stretch and is soft and is a def rent!!
Sized up two sizes and still too small on the top. Fit nicely everywhere else though.
This is such a unique dress. I was sooo glad I took advice of previous girls to size up. I would maybe even size up 2 sizes if you want a little extra room. I loved the very pale blue color.

This was for my engagement photos and it did justice to my figure!! The only problem is that I had originally ordered a 16 & backup 18. I then had to request for a size 20 and that was still snug on my boobs and arms. I'm a 42DD/DDD and 5'2".

Styled: Wore with a white/black Adidas hightop sneakers Fit: I wear anything from 6-8-10 depending on brand. Snug, yet comfortable so felt more like a 6. If you have a larger bust consider sizing up. I'm small-chested and it was a perfect fit. Pros: Could wear street-style and casual with cool sneaks or more professional with the right shoe, I'm 5"2' and I thought it could be too much fabric for my height and frame, but happy with proportion Cons: Wrinkles easily

links_reviews_title: Rented this to chaperone a homecoming dance. I got SOOOO many compliments from students!
links_reviews_text: Tight at the bust for 34C

I loved the way this dress looked. I want to rent it again. Received lots of compliments. The color and fabric are beautiful though it wrinkles very easily. You'll probably need to iron it when you receive it.
The overall fit is good. But, I have a small chest and it is still pretty tight. I love the color and the pockets! I decided to wear footless tights since it has been unseasonably cold!
Wore this to work got so many compliments. Went a size up and still had slight issues in the chest area.
Super cute dress for a sneaker fundraiser event. It was pretty snug though. I usually am between a 0 and 2, and the 2 buttoned... but barely!
I do like this dress. The design and color are great. However it wrinkles very easily. Not best for larger chested ladies like myself. The buttons pull.

I literally just wore this out to coffee with friends because I didn't have any great events to wear it to! This dress is such a great statement piece. The color is super cute. I felt like it was a little tight around my chest and rib cage. I could have gone up a size.

links_reviews_title: I want one in every color
links_reviews_text: Dress is perfect EXCEPT I had to size up a couple sizes because arms were super tight and I could barely button up the chest in sizes 16-18. Size up! Everything else is so lovely :)
A little snug in the chest area but good nonetheless! Loved it!
Wore this for work and dressed it down with converse. Super comfy and fabric is really soft. The tied belt really accentuates your waist! Would rent again

Great dress! The fit worked for me, albeit it was tight in the shoulders (my shoulders are a bit broad). I could see how this might not fit a larger busted woman. The material is thicker than I thought, which was good since it wasn't see through. It does wrinkle so be prepared to iron before wearing.

links_reviews_title: Unique work outfit for Texas heat
links_reviews_text: Pros: It is flattering, very unique style, and has pockets. Cons: wrinkles easily when you sit in the dress.
Stylish yet work appropriate. Very unique look, got so many compliments.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful, but very tight in the chest
links_reviews_text: I loved the elegant pale blue color. The cut and tailoring are wonderful - the material is a heavy cotton sateen, with a ton of stretch and a satisfying heft. I loved the feel of it. The only warning is that it's a button down and it's INCREDIBLY tight in the chest. I'm somewhere between a 34B and a 36B, and the size 10 from just about every brand is large in the chest by a bit. But this one was extremely tight! The front of it was gaping. I ended up wearing it but putting safety pins in between each of the top buttons. The contrast between the tight fit in the torso and the more A-line skirt creates a very flattering silhouette, but if you're larger than B cup, don't bother!
Hits every curve with ease. Perfect for any sexy librarian look or an evening on the beach
I am normally a 12 had to go up to a 16!!!
Cute! Love the handkerchief hemline and denim like fabric. The top was tight around the chest and it wrinkled throughout the day but it was a fun piece that I would rent again!

This is the most flattering dress I have ever worn. The material is so soft and breathable. The length is perfect too! I wore this to work, to a customer visit, and out to brunch with my friend (pictured). I will most definitely be renting this again!
I'm a big gal with big arms. Dress fit everywhere but arms were a little tight. LOVED THE DRESS! Material is awesome!

This dress is so cute and fun! It's youthful and professional. I agree that the bust area is snug and one of my buttons actually came open at one point in my day. It also does wrinkle easily which wasn't great for the back because of the up and down out of my office chair. But the fabric has a nice stretch and softness to it and holds up a professional look.

Great quality rental, the material is medium weight and the colour is a very pale ice blue. Really like the juxtaposition of the more fitted, preppy top of the dress with the more fun, handkerchief type hem of the bottom. Great mix of classy and cool. I paired with some statement pumps to edge it up a bit but would work well with a nude or solid colour too. Was almost too tight in the chest but purely because I was wearing a fairly padded bra. If I'd been wearing a normal bra it would have been perfect and the slight tightness of the buttons is easily fixed by leaving it open anyway.
I lived for this dress! The material is very stretchy and gave a 50's vibe with the silhouette . Cons: not for the super busty. I am a 42H and I had to use garment tape to Keep the buttons closed.

Wore this to my first fitting. It's a really great modern twist on a classic style. The waist fit perfectly and the buttons all the way down made it easy to get on and off. Felt like a very independent need-no-man 2019 Betty Draper. :)

Well constructed, lovely color, heard lots of compliments all day from strangers. But should be noted that the material is little heavy and thick, gets wrinkled super easily. You must iron before you wear it. I ordered 6 cuz 4 was not available, and it was comfy, but I think I would've enjoyed fit of size 4 more.

I rented 2 sizes larger (18) than my usual size (14) and it fit perfectly. I love the color and the cut, especially the bottom. I was on the fence about buying it but ended up sending it back. Might rent again. Only downside is I found the belt a little awkward to tie in a way that looks nice, but that probably speaks more to my lack of ability. :)
Too small. Did not wear.

links_reviews_title: Casual Dress with some Flair. Sadly, too light in the chest. If you are busty, size up!
links_reviews_text: Going to need to order a bigger size. Way too tight in the chest.

links_reviews_title: Cute, but tight in the chest
links_reviews_text: Beautiful color and material, but unfortunately the top was incredibly tight. So tight in fact that I had to return it. Everything else was fantastic and I will probably try it in a larger size soon. For the plus size ladies out there, definitely add this to your list.

Wore it shopping and to dinner while on vacation. Every store I went in, I got complimented on this dress!!! It was so comfy. And looked stunning. Absolutely adore this dress! Hello, pockets! The only thing is it runs VERY small. But I sized up knowing that from other reviews. I'd normally be a 12-14 in dresses... I rented an 18. I was going to get a 16 but it wasn't available, the 18 had some room in it, but not sure that the 16 wouldn't have been too small in the chest. I will definitely rent this again or buy it right now since its 60% off. My current weight loss plan is the only thing stopping me since it's an 18.

links_reviews_title: Imposible to wear runs to small normally I am a 10 this one was a 12 and I've couldn't close it

links_reviews_text: So pretty and classic. Too tight in the busy will rent an 8 next time. I pinned it shut but when I sat down it looked like I was busting out. Has pockets. Needs to be ironed
Pros pretty color and fabric Cons runs extremely small bust and arms
I am usually a 12 in dresses, sometimes a 14 if the waist runs small. Even the 14 was too small for my waist. Looked cute.

links_reviews_title: Comfy and flattering dress for pregnancy
links_reviews_text: Rented this 19 weeks pregnant and felt very cute and confident. Only complaint is that the material gets wrinkly really quickly in the skirt but didn't bother me too much. Material is stretchy in the arms which was nice.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous puffy coat with lots of warmth
links_reviews_text: I took this coat snowshoeing in VT and I was perfectly warm. There is a subtle leopard print on parts of the jacket and a detachable hood. Will definitely rent again.

Other reviews are true - not super flattering, but has a very 90s-ski-starter jacket vibe. Definitely normcore fashiony. Wore to Jackson Hole for skiing and was actually warm. Would recommend as a fun alternative to a puffer. Has good pockets and nice features for an actual wearable jacket. Hood is removable.
I REALLY wanted to love this. It's amazing quality but soooo unflattering. Very "bubbly" looking. I like oversized things, but this was even too much for me!
Great jacket, was perfect for this weather. I found the sleeves a little too large and bulky but would def recommend!!!
Great material and fit in the body. Sleeves are a bit short.
Great jacket and I took it to vacation but could not zip it. Something was wrong with the zipper. Ended up having to purchase a jacket at the resort. Not happy.

It was too warm for my needs, and huge. It's a very stylish oversized ski jacket. If you live in a place with snow, rent it. I tried it in rainy SF and it was just too much jacket. I have a small frame but border on small-medium and I got lost in this jacket. Size down.
I loved the jacket but it was so big there was no way I could wear it without looking ridiculous

I'd buy these if they weren't pricy. They're the perfect shade of denim, I love how high waisted they are, the cropped flare is so fun and they pair easily with a lot of things. I did go one size up than my norm (28) glad I did so I had wiggle room around my waist cause these have no stretch.
These were so fun to spice up my work wordrobe. They were a bit tight on the crotch area (lots of washing, maybe) but were flattering and fit well on my waist (high waisted). def recommend!

So fun and on trend. A great rental as I don't think I'd want to spend $200+ on these, but they were super cute and fun to wear for a month. Husband didn't love them as this style isn't the most flattering, but I still loved them, felt super cute in them, and wore them a half dozen times.
I received so many compliments on the adorable jeans.

links_reviews_title: The jeans were flattering and made me feel comfortable for the perfect night out
links_reviews_text: Rented for Summer Night out
Went one size up. These are thick denim and high rise, no stretch. They were good not great.
Great pants! Loved the look. They don't have any stretch but I squeezed myself into them. Next time I will probably size up

I like the high waist and wide legs of the Sacha style. They do run small. I usually wear a 28 but in these I wore a 30. I have also rented the Emma style which didn’t work for me because when I went up a size the waist got very large. With these, the size 30 gave my booty and thighs more room but still nipped in at the waist. They’re a great cut for an hourglass figure.

links_reviews_title: Prefer the similar J-Brand pair to these
links_reviews_text: I tried a similar style in J Brand and liked them...but in this brand this style looked awful on me, especially around the hip-flexor area. Returned unworn. Stiff.

links_reviews_title: Jean gaucho pants good for spring
links_reviews_text: I loved the look of these jeans but they were not forgiving and uncomfortable when I sat down especially around the thighs.
I absolutely loved these jeans. The fit was perfect. They are high waisted but aren't too tight. The wide leg is still flattering. I couldn't get enough of these jeans.
Loved the fit of the jeans with booties! I'm a little shorter so probably would be more cropped on longer legs! True jean material that did not stretch out through the night!

links_reviews_title: The fit on these jeans are amazing! I love the true high rise & flare. Casual cool.
links_reviews_text: The rise on the jeans are amazing! I love how "truly high rise" they are. They hit perfectly! I also love the flare on the bottom, I paired them with sneakers and a sweater, and it made my outfit a little more elevated versus skinny jeans. I would say that I normally wear a 27 in a stretchier jean and a 28 in Levis, and the 28 are a little snug on the thigh. If I went up a size, they would've been too large but not horribly uncomfortable.

links_reviews_title: Loved these so much I bought them.
links_reviews_text: These are my favorite jeans hands down so flattering on full figures women.
A little tight in the waist but very flattering!
I'm a 27 or 28 in most jeans. These I couldn't even get one button done! Definitely size up a few sizes.

I tried these on last summer in a size 25 ( I'm 5'9 122 lbs) and they were snug Bigger size was sold out I saw they were available on RTR and ordered, but the size calculator sent a size 24. They are really cute IRL Will re order in a bigger size Note : I have unlimited , and the sizing for all other orders has been perfect

They suggested I size down but it was a SQUEEZE to get these buttoned. I would get your normal size. Perfect denim to try out but not pay for given the very specific trend. Super rigid with no stretch which I don't mind but also why I'd stick with your normal.

links_reviews_title: Super cute, SIZE UP if you have a booty!
links_reviews_text: These were really great jeans for work and going out, I love how high the waist is. However, if you have wide hips you WILL need to size up. I am normally a 26 in jeans and I should have went to a 28 for this brand, but the waist would have been huge. They only give a little after wearing them in a bit, but they do NOT stretch, so be conscious about sizing.

I love these even though January/February was a little too cold to wear them ha! They are so comfortable and cute. Just an FYI, they have a button fly vs a zipper, but the buttons were easy to work with. Can't wait to re-rent and maybe even purchase these once it warms up a bit!

I am amply blessed in the booty and thighs area. (I usually wear a 14 easy). I could get bottom and top button on fly buttoned but def none in the middle were going to button. These pants are adorable but not for you if you have a bountiful booty! I SO wished they would have fit!
Was not able to wear them because they were too small, but they were super cute
These were cute jeans but they just didn't look right on my petite frame. Also they have a button fly - I find that to be endlessly frustrating. Ultimately returned unworn
I usually wear a 25 or 25 but I knew the material would be stiff so I sized up. Fit well, just a bit big. I got several compliments. I wore several times.
These were tight and have no stretch. I think they look more cropped on the model but too long on me (5'4") to achieve the flared cropped look.
No stretch. I usually wear a 14R or 32 and I couldn't get these over my hips.

links_reviews_title: Nice thick material but not for curvy gals
links_reviews_text: When I put them on, the legs were tight through the upper thigh, but huge gaping in the waist.
I sized up after reading the reviews and am glad I ddI. These fit like a dream and go with everything! Considering buying- absolutely love them!

These were the high-rise, wide leg jeans of my dreams. I got a 26, which fit perfectly in the butt and thighs, but was a bit loose on the waist (hello, pear shape). Really high quality denim that's thick, with no stretch. These jeans really elevated my basic crop top.

links_reviews_title: I can only fit into 27 if it has lots of stretch! Should have got 28-29
Comfortable and made my butt look great :)

links_reviews_text: Usually wear 27, followed reviews and ordered 28, still way to small! I would have loved to have worn these jeans, really cute.

Fit great! In love with the high waist with a light blouse tucked in. Seriously considering buying. Lots of compliments and my butt looks awesome in these! Like others mentioned, very limited stretch.
really loved these jeans!
Great pit of jeans to add a little flair to any outfit. Very flattering to the waist and butt too, but agree with other reviews the material is stiff at first and tight through hip flexors
Ran small in the waist, no shape and very stiff.
I am obsessed with these jeans! I bartend in them and they keep me cool and looking cool
I loved the high waist and cropped, bell bottom leg. However, the button fly made my stomach pooch out a little more than normal. Would have far preferred a zipper!
Would have loved them more if they were a short option but totally loved the jeans and received many compliments!

These jeans are probably my favorite rental piece since I joined unlimited. They are high waisted and a little snug in the waist area, which surprised me a little since they fit in the hips but they were worth that little discomfort because they were so darn flattering everywhere else. Plan to rent them again

links_reviews_title: Look good on all those video conferences!
links_reviews_text: I rented this before I knew I'd be working from home indefinitely. But it looks really good on all my Zoom calls! A little short in the torso, so wear it with high-waisted pants.

Wore this out for a friends birthday party. I loved the colors. It fit true to size but was on the short side (but I have a large bust that tends to influence this). It felt fun for a night out but not super spectacular

Flattering but it rode up a bit during the day when walking around and i got the larger of my 2 typical sizes. Looked cute with blue and black jeans and cute with a leather Moto jacket. Got a few compliments.

links_reviews_title: Great work shirt -- it's a bit short on the torso like a crop but great with higher pants
links_reviews_text: Even cuter in person. I got a lot of compliments. It runs a bit like a crop top, so wear with higher pants. I have a short torso so probably even more of a crop with taller people. But it worked with my high waisted pants.
Not a wow rental but does the job. A shorter fit but not too cropped.
This top is super cute and comfortable. Seriously considered buying it because it's a great piece. I wore it with jeans and could also see dressing it up with a pencil skirt or colorful dress pants.
This blouse was perfect for work, and I got so many compliments on it!
This was a pretty top. It was a little short so it's probably best to wear with high top pants.
It ran a touch short, I do have a long torso though. The elastic gathering at the bottom helped keep the top in place.

I love the colors and style. I'm not crazy about things tight around my neck but I got used to this. It feels a little short, but I don't think it is as short as it feels. I will probably rent this one again. Easy to dress up or down.

The only reason I was able to wear this top was because of the long pencil skirt I paired with it. Otherwise this shirt would have been almost a crop top on me if I wore it with jeans. Nice pattern and color scheme. Elastic on the waist and neck allows for easy on and off while providing comfort throughout the day. Fine shirt to wear for one work day, but probably won't rent again.

links_reviews_title: Pretty, unique top, a little short
links_reviews_text: This was great for wine tasting; it was a fun different print, and I liked that it was light and fun, but not see through or fussy. It is short, though, I had to keep pulling it down all afternoon.
Love this top. It can be dressed up or down. Great fit and quality.

I really loved wearing this top! The color is great and the material is very light. Worked great to wear out to a festival on a quick vaca. I wore higher waisted jeans to feel comfortable with the length. I am between a 14 and 16 and rented the 16 since it was the only size available. This seemed to work out because of the short style of the top.
Nice material, pretty print. There is a lot of extra fabric, not flattering for someone on the thinner side. Wore it tugged in to hide the extra material.

links_reviews_title: Felt super stylish, was able to pair well with other items I own
links_reviews_text: Fit is a little short but paired with a black tank top underneath that worked perfectly to complete the look
The fit is perfect. I loved the colors and decided to wear with a pair of my own J Crew orange pants with brown sandals. The top pairs well with a variety of bottoms. It
The high neck style isn't usually my favorite but this shirt was great for a casual day out in the city
Cute too. Runs a little too short.

I loved this top and would consider owning it. I wore it twice. Once with navy and once with black pants. Super comfortable. Could add blazer if needed. The cinching around the waist and collar add nice detail.
This blouse fits true to size. Love the bright print. I think this will be on rotation in my closet all summer!
The blouse is super cute & very comfortable

links_reviews_title: Fun Top with Pops of Color
links_reviews_text: I wasn't sure if I like the gathering of this top around the neck. Gave it a try anyway and ended up being a nice switch from my usual. Was complemented a few times on it. Flattering peplum.

links_reviews_title: Cute basic floral top, nice for work!
links_reviews_text: Love the beautiful print of this top. Classic to J Crew, it doesn't have much shape and isn't super flattering. But for a beautiful print under a cardigan, it's great! I sized up because I typically need to with J Crew, but my true size would have been better.

links_reviews_title: Love the color scheme, shirt is a little too short.
links_reviews_text: The only hang up I have with this top is that it's a little shorter than I like. Wore it with pants today, but it rode up a lot. Next time, I'll try a high waisted skirt.

links_reviews_title: Very short, Not for long torso individuals.
links_reviews_text: very short was unable to wear.

links_reviews_title: You'd Better Like a Cropped Top
links_reviews_text: I wear a ton of J Crew so I know how their sizes fit me. This one was so odd. It was super cropped -- maybe that should have been obvious from the picture but it wasn't to me. So the bottom of the "ruffle" hit the top of my high-waist jeans. I've got a gut and it was incredibly unflattering. If you've got a flat tummy, go for it!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful abstract floral. Beware of ruffles & short waist
links_reviews_text: Rich colors and modern floral pattern make this fresh. Ruffles on the neckline and hemline make it a bit too frilly for anyone over 35. Short waist with an elastic waistline causes the bottom ruffle to ride up, making the fabric bunch up around the waist and show midriff if you're not careful.

This top is darling! It is cropped, so be mindful that you'll need to wear it with something high-waisted or have some midriff showing. I wore this twice and revived so many compliments! I will definitely leave in my hearts to rent again.
I usually wear an 8. I sized up, per RTR's recommendation and because I'm busty. I definitely could've worn an 8. I think the cut of the blouse lends it to be more flowing and loose.

links_reviews_title: Great top that's elegant but not fussy
links_reviews_text: Very happy with this too and got lots of compliments when worn with jeans.

links_reviews_title: Love these colors but the cut was too boxy
links_reviews_text: Peplum tops never work for me, but I couldn't resist the colors of this top! So pretty. Unfortunately, it made me look too boxy and I wasn't able to wear it. Definitely give it a shot if you're able to wear the style!
This is such a cute and flattering top. If it cost less, I would buy it! You can dress it up or down. RENT IT!
I loved this blouse. It was the perfect fit. It made me look so skinny. I had on pants, long brown boots and this blouse.
So cute and can be dressed up or down.
cute top!
Pros: Nice print. Worn with black cardigan and blue pants. Cons: Elastic around the waist doesn't give for those with a "pouch"
I love this print!!! The top was a little short for my liking, otherwise i probably would have bought it. Looks great with a cardi, dress pants and heels!
Such a cute and flattering fit. Everyone I walked by said something about it.
Way too short for work if I wasn't wearing tights. Even with the tights I didn't feel very comfortable, but I have a long torso, so this happens to me a lot with dresses.

links_reviews_title: Cute dress for work but a little too short
links_reviews_text: I wasn't expecting the length to be so much above the knee. I should have sized up, the fit was tight. Beautiful fabric and texture

links_reviews_title: Short but cute for winter or fall
links_reviews_text: True to size with no real stretch. Kind of short (and I'm only 5'2)... hits mid to lower thigh. Easy to match because it is blue,black and brown so I wore black tights and brown boots !
Used the dress for work and to go out later that day. Received many compliments. Fabric is fun. Very well done piece. Will rent it again.

It's a snug fit, especially on the upper arms, but it's also a bit stretchy so it doesn't feel too confining. Hard to tell from the model but the skirt is actually pleated, so it definitely has that school-chic vibe. The material is also quite thick, making it nice for winter despite the short sleeves.

Heavyweight fabric, impeccably cut. Too short for me without tights, but super cute with booties and opaque navy tights. A little fussy to zip, particularly where the zipper transitions from tweed to the knit of the collar. TTS, but I'd size up if you're between sizes.
Love the fabric, wore this in NYC in feb and was super warm! Fits amazing.
So cute and looked great on!

This dress was great for work and the in-between time of year when it's not too hot or cold. I loved the colors, cute cut, and ribbing around the neck. I sized up so it was ok to wear to work with heels and bare legs, and that was definitely the right move.
I have short legs and it was mid thigh, but fit like a dream and was great thick fabric. Definitely a 5!
Sat a little oddly at the waist but was cute. I liked the thick material. It was a little short on me.

Such a pretty dress. I got so many compliments on it at work! I wish it was cheaper to buy because it's such a classic piece. It was a little big in the waist but I'm usually between a 4 and a 6 and got the 6. If you're between sizes I would recommend the smaller. Loved it!
It is all about the gams in this one. Great and comfortable fit. Can get a little itchy on the zipper area but awesome dress. Considering purchasing I like it so much

Loved this dress so much and got so many compliments. It was a teeny bit tight in the shoulders but it still worked for me. I contemplated buying it, but it had several pulls in the fabric that I had to fix and seemed like it had a little too much wear and tear to pay $175 for.
The hem had fallen out in the back

links_reviews_title: It's a fun print (not my usual uniform of black dresses)
links_reviews_text: The dress is made of thick but comfortable material. I was surprised by the length though - I'm 5'2" and don't think I could wear this without tights.
Fun dress. Would probably be too short without tights. Ran true to size for me.
Great fit!

links_reviews_title: Fantastic fabric, but not as flattering on a short torso
links_reviews_text: The line of the skirt hit a little low for me (I have a short torso), so i didn't find it to be super flattering on my hips.

Really liked this dress. I loved the color combination and the tweedy/bouclé material. It fit beautifully with a slightly dropped waist and pleated skirt. I paired it with over the knee boots which worked perfectly. Definitely found it ran true to size. Great for work to drinks or an event. Check out more photos of the stress and how I style my other RTR daily rentals @luxeandlouche :)
This is a cute, unique, and warm dress that is good for fall/winter, but felt a bit immature for work.
Snug across my chest and short. I wore it to work but it was too short for me to feel comfortable in.
His dress is short. I am 5'8" so I felt tights were appropriate for the workplace! Really great dress.

The dress fit well but is rather bulky so it was difficult to wear a sweater or blazer over it because of the sleeves and it is not as flattering as a thinner dress would be. I got multiple compliments on it though and the dress is very cute.

This is an adorable mini dress in a vintagey tartan fabric that reminded me of retro upholstery (in a good way!) I was planning on styling the dress with navy tights and red mini boots, but I didn't wind up wearing it. I had hoped to wear it to work, but found it was just a bit too short for a business casual context. I might rent it again if I have the right occasion. Also of note, the thread was pulled in some places, which made it look more thrift-shop than high street.

It's starting to feel crisp in NYC and this dress was the perfect start to boots season! I really loved the print, the drop waist/length and flare of the dress. As noted by others the material is thick and stretchy and there is a lining. I'm petite but muscular so the sleeves were right against my arms but it was still comfortable. xx
Thick fabric. Very comfortable. Perfect for work
Perfect dress! I normally wear a 0 but sized up to a 2, and it fit perfectly. Received so many compliments!

Fits well. Looks very nice, expensive, and well made. Fits very well, true to size. Many people made comments as to how much they liked it. My daughter even got a chance to wear it to school. She loves it.

links_reviews_title: I got compliments everywhere I went!
links_reviews_text: This dress is gorgeous! I had strangers yelling compliments across the street to me :-)
Feminine and dainty yet classy
heavy tweed, super cute. slightly short for work.

The dress is a thick tweed. Fits nicely- the bottom of the dress is pleated. It is a tad short so I would wear with black tights and heels or with no tights and tall riding boots or flats. It is a very cute looking dress.
Nice fit, great fabric, cooler weather appropriate.
Truely runs small. Ordered a 4 and had to reorder in a 6. The 6 was perfect. The material is AMAZING. This may be one of my favorite dresses ever, not just from RTR.

This dress is not my typical style but I rented due to the positive reviews. I am so glad I did! Very cute and easy to wear. I paired it with navy tights in a brown boot, I received compliments on it all day.
Not something i would rent again but cute for work. The low waist was not super flattering on me.
Warm, proper, and cute. I wore it the office Christmas party and a dinner date.
Absolutely charming dress. Brilliant quality and fabulous fit. Heavy fabric so its suitable for fall and winter.
LOVE LOVE LOVE. Would buy if it wasn't so pricey. Only downside was the lining coming out of the bottom but that's no reflection on the PERFECT dress. Very comfortable and super flattering.
Great sweater! The neckline is unique and lots of people complimented me on it! Sweater is baggy so it's probably fine to size down if you have to. I had plenty of room in the small.

links_reviews_title: Great sweater for fall and skinny jeans
links_reviews_text: Love the fit and neckline. Perfect amount of room for a slight oversized look with black skinny jeans. Would look good with regular denim blue wash as well. I want to keep this!

This sweater is a nice material and has a unique neckline and detail. The fit does not flatter me in any way. It's slouchy through the shoulders but not oversized enough to look intentional. I think this would look great on someone with a smaller frame.
At moments I loved it, at moments I wasn't sure about the sweater. Has more of a boyish vibe than expected.
Really liked the neckline. I wore it with black pants , but you could easily wear with jeans. Met a girlfriend for lunch & she commented how cute the top was.
I could have worn this everyday. It's perfect, soft, and just simply cute!

Runs big, usually wear a medium but after reading that I can be pretty boxy, I got a small and it fit perfect. Tucked it into a leather pencil skirt for work. Then paired with distressed black jeans for the weekend.
The small fit great. Was glad I didn't size up to the medium. Really high quality material. Meant to be a loose fit

links_reviews_title: Bright white with interesting collar. Soft, medium weight. Casual but trendy look.
links_reviews_text: A little boxy, had to roll up sleeves, wonder how the S would fit but this is still okay on the generous side
Very cute style but runs big. I don't like boxy shirts so I sized down and it was still bulky. Two sizes down would be too small so I made it work.
Love the design, but had a few fit issues. Runs large, so I wish I would have ordered a S. If you are between sizes, size down. Also, as someone with a long torso, the length was a bit short.
The fit was perfect - slightly slouchy. I tucked it into a black silk skirt. Wore it the next day with black skinny jeans for a more casual look.
I loved this! The fit was perfect! Wore it with black jeans and sandals it looked great and was cozy!

Not itchy or staticky at all, not see through, slight boxy fit with slight dolman tapering sleeves, but does not look frumpy at all. A thin material that feels like high quality cotton. A bit short but not cropped. Debating whether to keep, dry clean only
I enjoyed the design of this sweater, as well as the fabric. The cut what was little cropped than I thought. I'm 5'10 and the sweater came to the top of my jeans.
super comfy

links_reviews_title: Easy to dress up for work (and still be cozy) or just toss on with jeans
links_reviews_text: Great and discrete way to show off a neckline. Not too heavy, but still cozy.
loved this!

links_reviews_title: Needs accessories to brighten it up.
links_reviews_text: fits fine.
This top, black pants, and boots... perfect.

links_reviews_title: Great everyday sweater with a modern feel
links_reviews_text: This sweater feels like a sweatshirt but looks SO much classier! This is my second time renting it, if I end up renting it again I'll just buy it
This was very cozy and cute! Cool neckline.

links_reviews_title: Very comfortable and a great fit.
links_reviews_text: The sweater kept it's great shape all day even after a full day of work and playing with my toddler. The material is thick which I also like.

links_reviews_title: Nice spin on a classic sweater
links_reviews_text: This fit well; it was a lounge sweater so I tucked the front into jeans and wore to work with flats. I really like the symmetrical neck detail. I wore this twice. Overall I liked it.

I read the other reviews and ordered a L instead of an XL, and it fit great. XL would have been too big. The piping and asymmetrical cut dresses up what would be a plain sweatshirt. I wore it a few times and got a lot of compliments. I would rent this one again.

The look of the sweater was good and I liked the dark strip running across it. It definitely had a loose fit, and the neckline was cut too wide for me. If the sweater would have shifted left/right, my bra straps would probably have shown. The sweater was comfortable enough, but I thought the material was going to be like a sweatshirt, which it wasn't.
Thinking about buying it. Nice fabric perfect for spring.
Fell too short for my taste
It was just an every day sweater. Cute with black pants and a punch of red
Simple and cute and elegant and flattering. This is a great sweater to permanently add to your wardrobe.

links_reviews_title: It was just ok. Runs short.
links_reviews_text: Runs short. If it had been a little longer I may have worn it.
Everyday casual wear but with a twist. Can dress it up for low key girls night out or throw it on for Saturday morning errands.

links_reviews_title: It's a fun sweater to casually wear around town
links_reviews_text: It fits true to size. Didn't love the neckline

A lot of comments says it runs large. Actually I think it runs true to size, but depends on how you want to wear the sweater. I did size down and it was fine for me, if you are going for a more fitted look. But if you want a baggier/looser look with the sweater, go for the size you normally wear. Sweater is thick, beautiful material. A lot of compliments at work with this as well.
Heavy and frumpy, I sent it back without wearing.

links_reviews_title: A sweatshirt cut with non-sweatshirt fabric
links_reviews_text: If you're looking for a sweatshirt, this runs true to size, but the fabric is dressier and could drape better sized down one size I think. I did like the design but it hung on me like...a baggy sweatshirt!
This sweater is well made, however runs big. It was just OK, but worked well for New England winter weather.

links_reviews_title: Loved it! Definitely runs true to size, probably should have gotten a XL.
links_reviews_text: Love the shape and feel of this - definitely feels lux.

links_reviews_title: Loved it! So comfortable and goes with lots of things.
links_reviews_text: Great fit, beautiful color, soft.
Loved the asymmetrical style of the sweater. Comfortable on but ran big - still wore it.
Absolutely loved this coat. Got lots of compliments. I'm usually a 4 but sometimes a 6 and this coat was just ever so slightly big, but I actually liked the oversized look. I'm 5'5 and 127 lbs

Love the vibrant color of this coat. It is perfect for the first days of spring. It is light-weight, warm and beautifully made. A true designer item. The fabric has depth and richness, without formality. So happy to wear this.

Great color for cool toned skin. I got a US 6 UK 10 and I could have easily gone down one size for a good fit in the shoulders and down three sizes for the waist. I used a leather obi to winch it in. The buttons are hanging on quite literally by a single thread; the coat is definitely showing wear. The sleeves are quite long so it's a good choice for taller ladies. I love it so much for the color that despite the sizing and wear I am pretty sure I'd rent it again.

links_reviews_title: I mean, the colors are to die for.
links_reviews_text: This was a bit boxy for my normal taste, but it definitely worked! I think I would rent a size or two smaller next time. Got lots of compliments!
This is meant to be an oversized coat. Such a beautiful bold color.
Loved the color and print. Not that warm even though 30% wool. I sized down one and it fit perfectly.
